title: Baigorri 2015 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica Viura (Rioja)
description: Waxy lightly toasted aromas of yellow apple are more subtle than popping. This barrel-fermented wine offers good weight and balance along with quiet flavors of spiced apple and vanilla. A sophisticated clean finish is lightly oaked in flavor and smooth in feel.

title: Consejo de la Alta 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Rooty aromas of licorice and sarsparilla are oaky and toasty, like burnt bread crust. This reserva feels weighty, but well balanced. Spicy currant and plum flavors are racy and improve on an elegant finish that doesn't overreach. Drink through 2026.

title: Tossals 2015 Junior Red (Montsant)
description: A vibrant purple color and foxy berry aromas announce the jammy palate and punchy acidity of this wine. It tastes of herbal plums and berries and doesn't hold up on the oaky, pulpy finish.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2017 Conde Valdemar Blanco White (Rioja)
description: Apple and melon aromas are friendly and open. Tangy acidity straightens out an otherwise plump palate, while nectarines and slightly tropical flavors are ripe, round and flow nicely across the finish.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Summa Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Black-plum and cassis aromas include an exotic spice note akin to cardamom. In the mouth, this is smacking and dense. Baked black-fruit flavors include notes of black coffee, cocoa and burnt toast. On the finish, this stays chocolaty in flavor and comfortable in feel. Drink through 2026.

title: Luis Cañas 2014 Selección de la Familia Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A saturated color and aromas of ripe black fruits, perfumed oak, vanilla and oud wood are welcoming, while this Reserva feels lush but also racy due to vital core acidity. Toasty oak and deep berry flavors finish long and smoky. Drink now or hold through 2027.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2017 MM Selección Especial Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: A rusty orange color and mild aromas of cantaloupe and watermelon open this Cava. On the palate, this feels saucy and foamy. Wood-tinged flavors of red bell pepper and clover finish short and spicy. Overall, this is good but unusual for rosé Cava.

title: Dominio Basconcillos 2011 Estate Grown 12 Meses en Barrica Made with Organic Grapes  (Ribera del Duero)
designation: Estate Grown 12 Meses en Barrica Made with Organic Grapes
description: This is a concentrated bruiser from a ripe warm vintage. Aromas of cheesy oak, vanilla, maple and blackberry require as much air as possible. Saturated, heavy and jammy on the palate, this pounds the palate with rugged tannins. Flavors of blackberry, prune and chocolate finish thick, chewy and grabby. This is not about elegance—it's all about power and concentration. Drink through 2025.

title: Chozas Carrascal 2015 Las 2ces Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: This Bobal's dark, earthy berry and leather aromas are closed but presentable. On the palate, herbal plum, tomato and lightly baked berry flavors finish with the scrub of rustic tannins.

title: Bodegas Caudalía 2015 Xi'ipal Las Bajadas Single Vineyard Martín de Unx Garnacha (Navarra)
designation: Xi'ipal Las Bajadas Single Vineyard Martín de Unx
description: This wine's spicy plum and berry aromas are lightly oaked and minty. It's fresh and crisp on the palate but almost raw, with rubbery tannins and plum, currant and vanilla flavors. It's dry and spicy on the finish.

title: Bovale 2015 Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: A nose comprised of bubble gum, floral plum, berry fruit and oak aromas is simple and sweet. This exudes hard rubbery tannins, while flavors of milk chocolate, cherry and marshmallow end with a hint of vanilla along with a reprise of hard tannins.

title: Pazo de Barrantes 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Yeasty melon, hand soap and geranium petal aromas lead to a chunky palate that's a bit soft and overweight. Flavors of briny citrus, green herb and peach pit do their best to hold up on the finish. Drink now.

title: Alidis 2017 Tinto 6 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Slightly volatile berry and plum aromas settle without too much salad dressing character. A dense, jammy palate is on the fat side, while this tastes of black fruits, chocolate and herbs prior to a grating finish with some heat.

title: Ego Bodegas 2016 Goru 38 Barrels Red (Jumilla)
description: A thick, heavily oaked nose smells of char, wood grain and clove more than anything fresh or natural. A sappy, extracted palate feels resiny, while oaky, jammy flavors of spiced gumdrop and blackberry finish with hard, drying tannins. This is Monastrell, Syrah and Petit Verdot from a hot part of Spain.

title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2013 Anayón Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Aromas of raisin and lactic oak announce a baked-out Garnacha. A thick chunky palate is not a surprise given the nose, while this is quite oaky, with gamy black-fruit flavors. A stewed character and lemony oak control a heavy finish.

title: Pradorey 2009 Gran Reserva Finca Real Sitio de Ventosilla Single Vineyard  (Ribera del Duero)
designation: Gran Reserva Finca Real Sitio de Ventosilla Single Vineyard
description: No two ways about it, this hot-vintage Gran Reserva is a plush wine. It starts with baked cooked stewed aromas that render the nose asleep. A soupy stewy palate tastes of baked berry fruits, prune and chocolate. Consistent with the rest of the wine, this finishes soft. Drink now.

title: Finca Constancia 2015 Altozano Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Scattershot aromas of green herbs, mint and blueberries introduce this hard, flat wine. Its plum flavors are raw and minty, and the finish is harsh with green notes.

title: Bodega Andrés Iniesta 2016 Corazón Loco Red (Manchuela)
description: Foxy, candied raspberry and red-currant aromas smell leathery and damp. This blend of Syrah and Tempranillo is jumpy and chippy on the palate. Flavors of herbal red fruits are slightly green, while this feels gummy and grabby on a tannic finish.

title: Obalo 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Berry aromas are ripe and restrained as this flush Crianza opens. Fleshy weight and full tannins lend size to wild-blackberry and black-olive flavors. On the finish, this is rambling, rough and gravelly.

title: Museum 2012 Reserva Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Ripe berry aromas are a bit raisiny, with vanilla and balsam wood notes. This Tempranillo feels blocky, saturated and tannic. Flavors of raisin, prune, blackberry and wood spice are full and bullish, while a boundary-pushing finish maintains a palpable raisiny quality. Drink through 2020.

title: Maurodos 2015 Prima  (Toro)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas blend with notes of sandalwood, turned earth and graham cracker to form a complex and inviting nose. A dry tight tannic palate is proper and drumming, while this Toro tastes of blackberry and wood spice prior to a focused but dry and tannic finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Navas 1212 2016 Joven  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Candied red fruit aromas are rudimentary while suggesting sugar beets. A fleshy, widespread palate delivers herbal plum flavors, while this is short on the finish.

title: Marques de Griñon 2013 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Syrah (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: Stout, leathery aromas of black fruits and grilled meats are blackened and a true reflection of Syrah. This is expansive on the palate, but also acidic and abrasive. Flavors of baked black plum, blackberry and fig are intense. A chewy finish is ripped with power, an indication that this will last a long time; drink through 2027.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 Hoya de Cadenas Single Estate Chardonnay (Utiel-Requena)
description: Tropical fruit aromas are soft and syrupy. This is chunky and low in acidity, with oily stone-fruit flavors. The finish feels a bit warm and cloying.

title: Alta Alella 2017 Parvus Chardonnay (Alella)
description: Punchy aromas of citrus and tropical fruits are loaded with sweaty-smelling pyrazines. A pulling, lean palate has the texture of grape skins. Salty orange and pineapple flavors move fast and finish briny and tart.

title: Palacio del Burgo 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Open-grained oak aromas dominate a toasty nose with heat. This feels lean and tomatoey. Flavors of tart plum and pie cherry are almost sour and feel edgy due to severe wood tannins.

title: Carlos Serres 2017 Rosé (Rioja)
description: This salmon-colored blend of 80% Tempranillo and 20% Garnacha smells more rubbery and dense than fruity and lifted. A lemony palate is endowed with more than enough acidity, while this tastes strictly of tart citrus fruits.

title: Viña Otano 2015 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)
description: This shimmering barrel-fermented blend of 75% Viura and 25% Tempranillo Blanco opens with stable aromas of apple, butter and fresh corn. An elegant fairly light palate delivers a mix of dry oak, nectarine, peach and apple flavors. This is lithe and comfortable on the finish, with modest but noticeable residual oak.

title: El Coto 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Leafy red-plum and currant aromas are jammy and racy, as is a saucy palate that's rough and bumpy. Bold cherry and plum flavors are wild and gamy, while this feels flush and drying on a full-fruit finish.

title: El Cortijillo 2016 Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: This Tempranillo's cranberry and currant aromas are lean and raw. It feels capped and rough on the palate, with acidic scratchiness and choppy plum and currant flavors.

title: Latúe 2017 Made with Organic Grapes Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Cooked berry and plum aromas qualify as rustic. On the palate, this Tempranillo is grabby and scrubbing. Herbal plum and tomato sauce flavors are raw on the finish.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Mirgin Reserva Brut Nature Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Pink grapefruit and citrus-scented soap aromas form the opening. On the palate, this is fairly chunky, raw and rough. Orange and grapefruit flavors are average prior to a citric finish with pulpy weight.

title: Tossals 2014 Junior Red (Montsant)
description: Grassy raspberry and cherry aromas are a bit leathery. This Carignan-Garnacha-Syrah blend feels saturated but not entirely comfortable. Jammy ripe mixed-berry flavors are chunky, candied and finish hot, with chocolaty oak.

title: Sonsierra 2015 Selección Viura (Rioja)
description: Apple and melon aromas are easy to decipher. For a basic white wine, this feels good, fresh and mostly right. Modest generic white-fruit flavors are followed by a bready note of spent lees on the finish.

title: Mas Igneus 2017 Renéixer White (Priorat)
description: A slight pink color comes from the fact that while this is mostly Garnacha Blanca, there is Merlot and Garnacha Tinta in the blend. Aromas of peach pit and melon lead to a full palate that hits with acidity before turning creamy. Grape-skin contact during fermentation not only lends color but has given this textural grab and mild bitterness on the finish.

title: Rejadorada 2014 Reja  (Toro)
description: Underripe berry aromas are leathery and briny. This wine is bulky and chewy in feel, with herbal berry and rubbery flavors. A rustic finish with good mouthfeel delivers animal-like flavor notes.

title: Sonsierra 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cherry Life Savers candy aromas come with cedary oak notes and earthy density. On the palate, this is chippy and raw, with citric acid. Spicy, earthy berry and plum flavors are stretched out across a long finish with sharp, pointy residual acidity. For a difficult year like 2013, this is very good. Drink through 2025.

title: Campos Reales 2016 Rosé (La Mancha)
description: Chewing-gum aromas struggle to stay clean and fresh. This rosé feels rubbery and raw. Herbal flavors include juniper berry and finish with almost no fruit.

title: Blanco Nieva 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Lime and lemon aromas are clean and direct on the nose. This well-cut Sauvignon Blanc is crisp and light weight, with salty green-apple and citrus flavors that linger on the finish.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2012 Rioja Bordón Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy rooty aromas of licorice, anise, fennel and dried berry fruits are a bit herbal and raw. As for raw, the palate fits that description, with bumpiness to boot. Berry, oak spice and baking-spice flavors are steady on the finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Perinet 2015 1194 Red (Priorat)
description: From the opening gun, this is overtly and massively ripe, hence it smells of maple, raisin and prune along with crème de cassis liqueur. A heavyweight from front to back, this tastes of brandied black fruits, chocolate cake, clove and other baking spices. An unctuous finish is the opposite of light and dainty.

title: Maetierra Dominum 2009 QP Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas come with notes of beef stock and dried leaves. A clampy palate with rubbery tannins is the opposite of smooth, while this wine tastes of raw plum, berry fruits and grape skins. It feels pinchy on the finish.

title: Vall Llach 2016 Idus Red (Priorat)
description: Bold and welcoming black-plum and cassis aromas are helped out by a peppery spice accent. As per usual, this is a full-bodied but not over the top Carignan-Garnacha from one of the region's modern successes. Lush plum, wild berry and chocolate flavors finish savory and smoky not unlike beef jerky. Enjoy Idus through 2027.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Crucillón Red (Campo de Borja)
description: This wine's dusty raspberry and plum aromas are friendly and powdery. A 50-50 blend of Garnacha and Tempranillo, it's lively and tight, with generic black fruit flavors that finish minty and a touch raw.

title: Eguren Ugarte 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Lightly spiced plum and berry aromas are touched up by a dash of oak-driven cinnamon. While this crianza is a bit edgy and gravelly in feel, it deals solid dark-fruit flavors backed by spicy oak. A steady finish carries this blend of 90% Tempranillo and 10% Garnacha home.

title: Alonso López 2018 Tempranillo Rosé (Rioja)
description: A nonspecific nose with little to no fruit is innocuous, which is a good descriptor for this Rioja rosado. A plump palate is slightly chunky, while this delivers short, quick-hitting citrus and stone fruit flavors that barely register.

title: Maurodos 2014 Prima  (Toro)
description: Black-fruit scents combined with cheesy oak aromas are common for Toro. This wine has a wide, pulpy, grabby palate and flavors of black plum, herbal blackberry and savory meat. There's plenty of weight and substance, but it's also a bit stretched and bumpy along the way.

title: Valduero 2017 Yunquera Albillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Made from Albillo, a variety not known for its expressiveness, this offers dull white fruit aromas. The chunky palate deals flowery flavors of orange and persimmon that give way to a minerally finish.

title: Dominio de Punctum 2016 Lobetia Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Grapy aromas of black cherry are young and fruity but unsophisticated. This everyday Tempranillo is more superficial than deep in build. Sweet as well as peppery black-fruit flavors finish mild.

title: CVNE 2013 Viña Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dried plum and cherry aromas include spice and mulchy notes. This is yet another 2013 Rioja that's got issues—which doesn't mean this isn't without its charms. A tannic palate is raw and gritty but built to last. Cherry and red berry flavors finish short. Drink through 2034.

title: Matanegra 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Dense, charred aromas control a soupy nose with reduction and not much fruit. In the mouth, this is heavy, syrupy and in need of a lift. Flavors of black tea, cured beef and stewed plum finish hot.

title: Tamaral 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A big oaky can't-miss blast of clove and wood spice is more dominating than secondary berry aromas. This is resiny and full in body, with ample acidity. Oak plays a lead role on the flavor profile, which includes toast, mint and herbal black plum. A peppery toasty finish benefits from moderate juicy acidity. Drink through 2021.

title: Bodegas Bleda 2017 Castillo de Jumilla Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Scratchy, oaky aromas of pencil eraser, wood grain, vanilla and raspberry lead to a dense thick chewy palate. Herbal, salty plum and berry flavors finish tannic, grabby and sticky.

title: Emilio Moro 2014 Malleolus de Valderramio  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Even in a difficult vintage like 2014, this single-vineyard Ribera is strapping and impressive. Dark, smoky aromas of fine oak, wood spice and burnt toast are paramount to the wine's secondary fruit scents. A full, wide palate with strong tannins is home to blackberry, cassis, fig, chocolate and toasty flavors. On the finish, barrel char and lemony notes allow this to go the distance. Best from 2022–2038.

title: Gancedo 2009 Xestal Mencía (Bierzo)
description: The 2009 vintage was a hot one, so this wine's stewy, overripe aromas and deep, advanced color aren't shocking. In the mouth, it's generous with raisiny, ripe berry fruit, feeling undeniably heavy.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2017 Aragus Made with Organic Grapes Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of clove and red fruits are pushed by boisterous oaky tones. Clove and baking spice notes on top of easy berry fruit flavors are smoky and forced, while clove, campfire and barbecue flavors are more than a Garnacha of this quality can handle.

title: Protos 2016 P Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A mix of yeasty lemon- and orange-peel aromas are just inviting enough. This Verdejo has a plump but basic mouthfeel along with slightly bitter flavors of citrus skins and salt. A briny green-leaning finish suggests a wine that's beginning to fade.

title: Latitud 42 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Forced oak on the nose creates an early whiff of menthol and mint. A live-wire palate is charged up and resiny, while oaky flavors of black fruits and pepper end with a final hit of barrel spice.

title: CVNE 2014 Cune Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Murky aromas of leafy plum and compost announce a challenging wine from a difficult vintage. In the mouth, this reserva is outright thin. Tangy, tart plum and red cherry flavors are zesty as well as lightly green and herbal on the finish.

title: Alta Alella 2015 Capsigrany Organic Sparkling (Cava)
description: This tan-colored brut nature opens with yeasty aromas of brioche and oxidized apple. A foamy palate lacks clarity and smoothness, while this tastes like it smells: briny, yeasty and mildly oxidized. A fruitless finish is simply dry and bready.

title: Valdelana 2014 Agnus Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Spicy, briary berry aromas are subtle and reserved, but sound. This wine is firm and a bit drawing on the palate, with flavors of plum, berry fruits and cocoa. Mild berry flavors on the finish are tasty and not pushy or overdone.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2009 Glorioso Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy plum aromas are accompanied by appealing oak scents. While this wine doesn't show the greatest of ease and flow on the palate, flavors of plum, cassis, clove and cinnamon are persuasive. A blocky, rubbery, tannic finish with roasted notes is more about power than finesse. Drink through 2023.

title: Luis Saenz 2017  Rioja
description: Cherry, plum and coconut aromas along with a hint of vinegar make up the nose on this fresh but edgy Tempranillo. Flavors of red plum, olive and vinaigrette finish dry and woody in a highly basic but competent way.

title: Pazo Pondal 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Flowery aromas suggest air freshener. This feels plump, round and oily. Salty orange flavors are just ripe enough to be good, while this pushes the limits of brininess on a finish that offers a taste of the ocean.

title: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2015 Carodorum Crianza  (Toro)
description: Blackberry-jam aromas are full, flush and lush, but not what you'd call complex. A choppy lively palate with bruising tannins isn't shocking for Toro, while this tastes of ripe black fruits, mocha and chocolate. Despite having massive tannins, this Crianza finishes just smooth enough. Drink through 2024.

title: Vega Clara 2015 Mario  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe raisiny aromas teeter on the brink of overripe, while this feels heavy, hard and loaded with tannins. Baked berry, raisin and cassis flavors turn more stewed on a heavy finish with a prune-like aftertaste.

title: Viña Otano 2016 Viura (Rioja)
description: A yeasty, floral aroma leads the nose. This dilute Viura has little substance on the palate, while bland flavors of white fruits finish yeasty and slightly briny on a hint of melon.

title: Cellers Unió 2016 Perlat Red (Montsant)
description: Earthy aromas of tobacco, modest oak and berry fruits require airing to put their best foot forward. A slightly sticky and resiny palate is as full as it needs to be, while this Garnacha-Carignan-Syrah blend tastes of ripe berry fruits and spicy oak. On the finish, clove and herbal notes enter the picture.

title: Faustino Rivero Ulecia 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple, melon and sea brine aromas are typical of Albariño from Galicia. A plump palate is a bit low on kick and acidity. Dry melon and white fruit flavors are simple, while this tastes a bit yeasty on an easygoing finish. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Luzón 2018 Luzó Coleccion Blanco White (Jumilla)
description: Uncomplicated melon and yeasty vanilla aromas precede a ripe and lively palate, with punchy citrus, melon and tropical-fruit flavors. Tangy acidity pushes this basic white blend from Spain's southeast.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2016 Protocolo Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Slightly soupy plum and berry aromas open this generic red blend. A fleshy, tannic palate is mildly abrasive, while blueberry, cassis and herbal flavors are a touch green before hinting at chocolate and plum on a grabby finish.

title: San Vicente 2012  Rioja
description: This modern-style Tempranillo is registering at max ripeness. Aromas of black fruits, raisin, tire rubber and toasty French oak project a dark outlook. In the mouth, this is tight and gripping. Flavors of blackened oak, cassis and blackberry finish firm and closed, with manageable tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2018 Garnacha Rosado (Navarra)
description: A reddish color is normal for this type of Navarran Garnacha, while a fruity nose hints at peach and flower blossoms. A medium to full palate is on the lumbering side, while one-dimensional citrus flavors finish with controlled heat and burn.

title: Innatum 2015 Natural Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Stewed and raisiny are the two words to keep in mind when approaching this desiccated Garnacha. Fig, raisin and other overripe flavors don't change on a soft finish.

title: Artadi 2014 Garnacha (Navarra)
description: This wine's earthy cherry and plum aromas come with a hint of milk chocolate. The palate is edged with rubbery tannins, its savory, lightly salted plum flavors growing jammier and more fig-like as it breathes. A textbook fruit-forward Grenache.

title: El Coto 2018 Blanco Verdejo (Rioja)
description: Aromas of citrus, tropical fruits and pyrazines set up a basic palate with freshness but little to no depth. Grassy lemon-lime flavors are limited but finish clean.

title: Vetus 2016 Flor de Vetus Old Vines From Segovia Verdejo (Rueda)
designation: Flor de Vetus Old Vines From Segovia
description: White-fruit aromas and a prickly scent of cactus or nettle opens this tight, citrusy old-vines Verdejo. Matching the aromas, this tastes of pithy citrus, grapefruit and green herbs. A racy finish fades out nicely.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2011 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Front-loaded aromas of oak and vanilla lead tobacco, plum and berry scents on this classic-style Rioja reserva that's perky and grabby on the palate. Vanilla, cocoa and woodspice flavors are as prominent as those of cherry and plum, while mocha is the key flavor on a long, oaky finish. Drink this high-energy Rioja through 2025.

title: Aspaldi 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas are a touch baked and raisiny, which makes sense given the warmth and dryness of the 2011 vintage in Rioja. On the palate, this is dry as a bone, with cheek-pounding tannins. Flavors of roasted plum, red currant, tomato sauce and vanilla finish raw but also clean and true. Drink through 2024.

title: Emilio Moro 2016 La Revelía Godello (Bierzo)
description: Briny citrus and apple aromas come with a leesy note of lanolin. Sharp acidity bolsters the spine and structure of this Godello, while apple and bitter walnut flavors become even more tight, skins driven and bitter on the finish.

title: Viña Herminia 2014 Herminia  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of raw oak, vanilla and cherry settle with airing, but this Rioja feels a bit wiry and choppy. Plum, berry and oak flavors finish well, with bright acidity paving the way.

title: Campos Reales 2016 Canforrales Clásico Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Foxy plum and violet aromas introduce this basic Tempranillo. It's broad on the palate, with herbal plum and berry flavors, modest acidity and little structure or intensity.

title: Sonsierra 2017 Selección Tempranillo Rosé (Rioja)
description: A watermelon-red color and green-leaning aromas of beets and lettuce lead to a heavy palate. Briny red-fruit flavors hint at vinegar, while this maintains a salad-dressing quality on the finish.

title: Campos Reales 2015 Selección Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: This uncomplicated wine features ripe, jammy black fruit aromas. It's full bodied and fleshy on the palate, with blackberry and black plum flavors and a springy finish filled with chocolate notes.

title: Castaño 2016 Monastrell (Yecla)
description: This Monastrell's raisiny, candied aromas are ripe but a touch flat. In the mouth, it's raw and rough, with slightly abrasive tannins. Herbal red plum flavors accent its dry, scratchy finish.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2016 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Up front, there's no fruit to this and instead aromas of rot and chemicals. A bitter flavor profile dominated by grape skin and petrol culminates in a flat and tasteless finish.

title: Ego Bodegas 2016 Fuerza Red (Jumilla)
description: Huge smoky aromas are based on grainy oak but include notes of cola and warm earth. A saturated palate tips the scales toward hot and heavy, while this blend of Monastrell, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah tastes of toasty oak, clove and generic black fruits. A thick, oaky finish closes this out.

title: Emina 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Round, chunky aromas of grapefruit and passion fruit settle on friendly and varietally correct. This is snappy and solid in feel, with lime, orange and nectarine flavors. An acid-driven finish holds the line and doesn't taste bitter or green.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2016 Sagasta  (Rioja)
description: Spicy oak with a chocolate twist rests comfortably on top of berry fruit aromas. A racy, tough palate is rubbery but lively and balanced, while blackberry, plum and chocolate flavors simmer on a finish with clean but notable oak.

title: Viejo Mundo 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A clean nose plays up blackberry and cassis aromas, while a pulling palate offers Ribera del Duero's patented hard-clawing tannins. Roasted berry and plum flavors are lightly oaked and take on a savory character as this sits. Tea, olive and latent black fruit flavors push a rough-textured finish. Drink through 2028.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2009 Viña Albina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Savory, mature aromas of woodspice and earthy berry fruits form the greeting on this gran reserva that's more lively than subdued or silky. Spicy, oaky berry flavors have a ripe, rooty component, while there's just enough pop to a bold, baked, chocolaty finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Ochoa 2018 Calendas Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)
description: This Navarran Garnacha rosé is red for the most part, and the nose is not fresh but is instead funky, cheesy and stalky. A chunky palate doesn't shine, while this tastes oddly greasy and shy on fruit. Unfortunately, this is consistent with recent vintages.

title: Pagos del Moncayo 2015 Prados Privé Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Jammy berry and gaseous aromas require a lot of patience to sift through. This heavyweight Syrah-Garnacha blend feels wide, grabby and tannic. Blasting oak, chocolate and extracted berry flavors are expansive on a hot finish that reflects 15% abv.

title: Larchago 2016 Viura (Rioja)
description: Dilute melony aromas are slightly spoiled. This feels bland and unfocused. Modest white-fruit flavors are short and mildly bitter, while almond skin is the key flavor on a struggling finish.

title: Xucrogas 2016 Her Soul Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Peppy red plum and currant aromas are anything but serious. This Garnacha feels sticky and fairly flat. Candied cherry and raspberry flavors finish heavy and a bit cloying.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2017 Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)
description: Mild pyrazine-based aromas of bell pepper and hard spices blend with red-apple-skin scents on a midlevel nose. A narrow mouthfeel lacks elasticity, while this tastes of salt and savory tomato sauce. Savory more than fruity, this isn't bad.

title: Bodegas Fos 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Scratchy aromas of spicy red fruits and tree bark hold up to scrutiny, as do the oaky notes that create a vanilla essence to go with gamy berry flavors. A chewy, meaty finish belies this Crianza's low price tag.

title: Venta del Puerto 2013 No. 12 Selección Especial Red (Valencia)
description: Ripe berry fruit and gritty oak aromas lead to a full-bodied blocky palate with grating tannins. This is a heavily oaked blend of Syrah, Tempranillo and Merlot. Flavors of blackberry, vanilla and wood spice finish with barrel char and depth. Drink through 2023.

title: Gorrebusto 2016  Rioja
description: This wine's grapy berry aromas bring good vinegar to mind. Its raw, fresh palate is firm and far from fat and cushy, with briny plum and berry flavors. It has a hard grape skin-like texture on the finish.

title: Resalte 2015 Origen Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This opaque, big red opens with dark fruit and crude oil aromas smeared with smoke. A deep, lush palate deals a ton of berry fruit, with flavors of blackberry, cassis and dark plum transitioning seamlessly onto a long finish graced by lemony oak. Drink through 2030.

title: Emina 2014 Atio  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Bold black fruit aromas combined with scents of leather, herbs, oregano and wild desert brush make for a complex and intriguing nose. A bold, punchy palate is deep and intense, with flavors of blackberry, cassis, dark chocolate and coffee. A high-energy finish with rock-solid tannins ensures that this will last a long time; drink from 2020–2035.

title: Latitud 42 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas are oaky and include a note of woody vanilla. On the palate, this is tight and has a resiny texture from extended barrel aging. Oak-heavy flavors of vanilla and berries finish with chocolate and a medicinal hint. Drink through 2032.

title: Virgen de las Viñas 2017 Tomillar Chardonnay (La Mancha)
description: Sharp feline and pineapple aromas are inexact and are not typical of the variety. A full palate is propped up by tangy acidity, while this tastes of celery, green herb and apple cider.

title: Tamaral 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Overly ripe aromas suggest raisin and pencil eraser. On the palate, this is choppy and lacks flow. Baked flavors of raisin and prune are desiccated, while this tastes jammy and feels hot on the finish.

title: Numanthia 2012 Termanthia  (Toro)
description: Tarry blackberry and cheesy oak aromas are appropriate for a wine of this size and magnitude. In the mouth, this Tinta de Toro is expansive and grabby, with bullish tannins. Slightly salty earthy accents come with core blackberry flavors and notes of baking spices and chocolate, while on the finish this is long, chocolaty, delicious and not too hard or tannic. Drink through 2023.

title: Perelada 2012 Finca Malaveïna Red (Empordà)
description: This five-grape blend is muscular and wide on the palate, with oaky berry flavors that are also tarry and toasty. Hard tannins and some chop on the finish suggest further aging would be beneficial. Drink this Cabernet-led blend that also includes Garnacha, Syrah, Merlot and Cab Franc through 2025.

title: Raventós de Alella 2015 Santa Maria Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: This linear wine's neutral aromas vaguely resemble peach and peach pit. Its yeasty, leesy, oxidized white fruit and white bread flavors finish on a melony note but with little intensity.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2017 Deusa Nai Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A light color and stalky aromas of briny white fruits precede a chunky palate with a cidery mouthfeel. Briny stone-fruit and stale pineapple flavors don't have much to say on a plump finish.

title: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2013 Carodorum Único Crianza  (Toro)
description: Immensely ripe black fruit aromas are accompanied by no shortage of vanilla, chocolate and baked notes on the nose of this Toro heavyweight that spent 30 months in oak. The palate amounts to an avalanche of black fruit and tannins, while this tastes baked and exceedingly ripe. Touches of spice and complexity can be found on a finish saturated with blackberry and cassis flavors.

title: Vega Sicilia 2015 Alion  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of violet, blackberry and plum toggle between fruity and floral, while this ripe-year Tempranillo feels a touch heavy, with hard tannins. Baked blackberry and black-tea flavors culminate on a short finish, with minty oak notes and scrubbing tannins. Drink through 2026.

title: Rioja Vega 2016 Edición Limitada Rosado (Rioja)
description: Raspberry and plum aromas are fresh and inviting. A full, fresh, popping palate is lively, while a cross of cherry, raspberry and citrus flavors is whetting and tasty. A zesty, steady finish confirms the fairly high quality.

title: R+ 2012 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe, earthy berry and cassis aromas smell damp at first but unfold nicely. Bright acidity and abrupt tannins make for a packed palate. Lightly oaky flavors of plum and berry show a note of vanilla. It finishes crisp and choppy due to the aforementioned bold acidity. Drink through 2022.

title: Prada A Tope 2015 Palacio de Canedo Godello (Bierzo)
description: Dusty apple aromas show a good level of pop and freshness. This Godello feels round yet fresh. Yeasty, bready white-fruit flavors are more basic than specific.

title: Pazos del Rey 2016 Pazo de Monterrey Godello (Monterrei)
description: Mellow peach and apricot aromas indicate a mature but clean Godello. A round palate comes with a grape-skins texture, while bold natural acidity is keeping this lively. Briny orange flavors are a touch sour, while this is short on flavor but healthy feeling across the finish.

title: Tosalet 2014 Vinyes Velles Red (Priorat)
description: The fiery cherry and cassis aromas in this snappy wine include a rubbery Band-Aid note. Roasted tomato, plum and currant flavors are framed by lip-smacking tannins and tomato-like acidity, finishing with gritty intensity.

title: Oro de Castilla 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Grassy aromas and citrus notes dominate the nose of this Verdejo. It has an oily texture and a plump palate, with salty, lightly green citrus and stone fruit flavors that finish with residual saltiness.

title: Finca Albret 2018 Rocío Rosado (Navarra)
description: A rusty color and aromas of plum and apricot open this barrel-fermented rosé that isn't oaky in the least. A grabby palate has the feel of grape skins, while this is short on flavor and yeasty tasting, with a soft finish.

title: Finca Río Negro 2014 Cogolludo Guadalajara Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Racy red berry aromas bring a welcome herbal note along with kick. Packed with fruit on the palate, this blend of Tempranillo, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon tastes toasty and full, with blackberry and fudge flavors. Things stay dark and toasty on the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Castellroig 2014 Sabaté i Coca Mosset Corpinnat Brut Nature Sparkling (Spain)
designation: Sabaté i Coca Mosset Corpinnat Brut Nature
description: Smoky, stalky aromas of warm haystack are low on fruit. Throughout, this brut nature is dry and salty, with the lightest level of fruit that passes for ripe. Citrus notes on the finish get reduced to pithy grapefruit as this closes.

title: Heras Cordon 2015 Hacienda José Luis  (Rioja)
description: Berry, tomato and herbal aromas are spicy and earthy more than bold and fruity. This Rioja from a touted but warm year feels tight, with good body and balance. Spicy leafy flavors of lightly stewed berry fruits and chocolate finish short in length and complexity.

title: Vicente Gandia 2014 Bo Bobal Único Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Plump earthy berry and plum aromas are fruity and generally good. This Bobal has a grapy reduced mouthfeel that revolves around rubbery tannins. Black-fruit flavors come with chocolaty notes, while this is fleshy and tannic on the finish.

title: Finca Azaya 2016 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Sweet-smelling raisin, prune, licorice and chocolate aromas are fully ripe. In the mouth, this is plump but firm, with scratchy tannins. Prune, mocha and chocolate flavors are consistent with the nose, while this holds onto a raisiny sense of ripeness on the finish.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Mósen Cleto Crianza Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Spicy, scratchy berry aromas lead to a gummy, sticky palate with berry, plum and woody flavors that don't exactly sing in harmony. A thick finish, with excess weight, is fitting.

title: Pradorey 2010 PR3 Barricas Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This resiny, oaky Verdejo opens with a bright gold luster and spiced pumpkin and honeyed white fruit aromas. Its mature, lightly oxidized stone fruit flavors are backed by lingering toastiness. A full, textured finish closes it out.

title: Bodegas Iranzo 2016 Azul de Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Resiny oak aromas rest atop blackberry, raisin and prune scents on what amounts to a full but lazy nose. This Bobal is fleshy and tannic, with spiked acidity that provides a needed shock. Sappy berry, plum and resiny oak flavors finish jammy, tannic and a bit flat.

title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2016 Esencia Diviña Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Minerally aromas are balanced by light, elegant fruit scents akin to applesauce and pear. This feels refined on a palate that's only slightly pulpy. A fruit-bowl's worth of stylish citrus and apple flavors are lasting on the finish. Drink now.

title: Balbas 2009 Ardal Gran Reserva Selección Especial  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Baked raisiny aromas of spice cake are almost overdone. Like many 2009 RDDs, this is huge, tannic and massive as a whole. A woody flavor profile includes earthy jammy berry fruit, while this is heavy with campfire notes on the finish. This is 80% Tempranillo and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink through 2023.

title: Raimat 2013 Castell de Raimat Tempranillo (Costers del Segre)
description: Floral black-fruit aromas share space on the nose with olive and rubber notes. This Tempranillo feels rubbery and a touch collapsed, however its baked plum and jammy berry flavors are pleasing. Drink this easygoing wine now.

title: Bohigas 2015 X Xarel-lo (Catalunya)
description: Light aromas of mango, melon and lime are quiet but clean. This is a simple but fresh white with a crisp stony mouthfeel. Easygoing flavors of melon and apple finish with a note of lime as well as a hint of wheaty yeast.

title: Altavins 2015 Tempus Crianza Red (Terra Alta)
description: Earthy berry aromas are more subdued than bright. In the mouth, this feels a bit collapsed, syrupy and hot. Hefty cherry and black plum flavors are a touch oxidized and short on kick. This feels jammy and thick while tasting of spiced berry fruits on a finish that's sleepy as it expires. Drink now.

title: Viñestral 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Cherry, plum and balsam-wood aromas make for a good opening. This wine feels full, with cheek-grabbing tannins. Flavors of woodspice, cherry and plum hold appeal, but this feels a bit hot on the finish, with residual oak.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2017 Daimon  (Rioja)
description: Earthy red plum and raspberry aromas are leafy but also heavily oaked. On the palate, this Garnacha-led blend is sappy, resiny and fiery. Forced oak flavors of clove and nutmeg sit on top of berry fruit, with juicy acidity keeping things moving.

title: Celler Bàrbara Forés 2013 Negre Red (Terra Alta)
description: Ripe, slightly oxidized berry, raisin and Band-Aid aromas feed a tannic, grippy palate in this Garnacha, Syrah and Carignan blend. Its earthy berry and plum flavors are full and ripe, with a blocky, slightly medicinal finish.

title: Beronia 2009 Gran Reserva Tempranillo-Graciano  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of vanilla, tobacco, plum, currant and tomato leaf carry the nose. This Gran Reserva from a warm vintage feels full and jammy, with plenty of fruit weight. Blackberry, black plum and chocolate flavors give way to an easy fade on a fig-laden finish.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2012 Viña Pomal Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Soupy berry and raisin aromas are smoky but lack rigidity. An inward-pulling palate is tight due to fairly severe tannins. Dark-plum flavors are savory and a bit oaky, while this is powerful on a muscular finish with rubbery tannins and lasting savory flavors.

title: La Mejorada 2011 Villalar Oro Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Earthy slightly rustic aromas suggest compost along with ripe berry fruits. This feels wide and heavy, with an extracted mildly tannic mouthfeel. Prune and blackberry flavors don't see much acidic push, and thus this Tempranillo finishes blocky, ripe and chunky.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Privat PB Organic Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: This Xarello feels juicy and acidic but ultimately lean and simple. Its grassy aromas include a whiff of hay and a touch of mango while its generic citrus and tropical flavors finish with acidic pop.

title: Luis Saenz 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Grapy plum and berry aromas are dense and pulpy but entirely pleasant. In the mouth, this is a touch choppy and hard, with rubbery tannins. Beefy berry and savory plum flavors finish with vanilla and coffee notes along with sturdy tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Viñedos de Alfaro 2015 Conde del Real Agrado Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Wide berry and plum aromas are fruity but unrefined. This crianza is mostly Garnacha with Tempranillo, Graciano and Mazuelo. The palate is flush but drills down hard with tannins. Berry and plum flavors reflect a warm year and a warm subzone of Rioja (Alfaro).

title: Arrocal 2014 Ángel  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smoky oak tops a nose with root beer, chimney draft and heady berry aromas. A thick, creamy palate delivers the heft Ribera is known for, while this tastes of ripe blackberry, cassis, coconut, vanilla and mocha. A lush finish is packed to the brim, but while this is massively fruity and oaky, to call it elegant, sophisticated or refined would be stretching things.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2015 VII Tempranillo Rosado (Rioja)
description: Aromas of rhubarb and red-apple skins lead to a flat, fading palate. This tastes saucy, with no vibrancy or fruit character prior to a dying yeasty finish.

title: Palacio De Canedo 2016 Made With Organic Grapes Godello (Bierzo)
description: Apple, peach and butterscotch aromas are not distinct. A palate comprised mostly of acid has a skins-like texture, while this tastes slightly pickled, with citrus and pineapple notes. On the finish, this Godello is briny and cidery, with a touch of bitterness.

title: Capçanes 2017 Mas Donis Rosato (Montsant)
description: This wine smells like pizza—all yeasty, bready aromas with tomato and herb notes. It lacks structure on the palate, tasting salty, with nonspecific citrus flavors and a bitter finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2017 Lagunilla Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Baked berry, raisin and tobacco aromas set up a palate, with ripping acidity and bright flavors of plum, cassis and vanilla from modest oak. This tastes authentic for Rioja, meaning it's lightly fruity and lightly woody.

title: Txakoli Primo 2016 Zarautz Hondarrabi Zuri (Spain)
description: Tropical fruit and honey aromas set up a shy palate that's lightly spritzy. An odd mix of flowery honeyed flavors turns in the direction of pink grapefruit on a lean spritzy finish.

title: Señorío de Sotillo 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smooth, heady aromas of blackberry, cassis, tobacco, marzipan and vanilla are clicking on all cylinders while leading to a dense, saturated palate that only gets more dense and hard with airing. Blackberry, black cherry, coffee, mocha and caramel flavors conclude with notes of marshmallow and chocolate on a tannic finish with sharp teeth. Drink through 2025.

title: Viñedos de Alfaro 2018 Real Agrado Garnacha Rosé (Rioja)
description: Hints of plum and raspberry are found on a nose that smells like candy or chewing gum. This rosé is solid but basic in feel. Mild fruit flavors are generic but friendly, while this is clean yet vapid on the finish.

title: Viñas del Vero 2016 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: Light, pleasant apple aromas are about all this neutral Chardonnay is giving. Its mild palate with just enough acidity carries clean and easy melon flavors. A slightly briny note closes out the lean finish.

title: Pazo Pondal 2015 Leira Pondal Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Peach, orange and seafoam aromas are clear and uncomplicated. This offers good flow on a healthy palate, while salty citrus and stone-fruit flavors are steady on the finish. Drink now.

title: Ovidio García 2014 Esencia Crianza Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: This wine delivers a frontal blast of chocolaty oak and char. Its severely tannic palate overloads its generic black fruit with barrel notes. It finishes hot, with briary touches.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Fábula de Paniza Garnacha Rosé (Cariñena)
description: A clean but mostly neutral nose offers a note of nectarine prior to a solid but basic palate that has the texture of citrus peel. A mildly citric flavor profile ends with a slight note of oxidation. Drink now.

title: Astrales 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Lusty black-fruit aromas are earthy, oaky and smooth, exemplifying an excellent Ribera del Duero. A palate with pulsing acidity tempers rich flavors of blackberry, chocolate and vanilla. Creamy oak and some fire on the finish guarantee that this will evolve nicely through 2028.

title: Beronia 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Peach and tropical fruit aromas set up a round palate that's in balance. Apple, fennel and cilantro flavors wrap up quickly and cleanly on a simple but solid finish.

title: Losada 2016 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Spicy berry, oak, vanilla and schist aromas introduce a crisp palate with resiny oak. Dark plum and raspberry flavors are bolstered by oaky notes, while this tastes dark and chocolaty on a finish with fresh acidity and scratchy tannins.

title: Alvides 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of olive and rubber share the nose with leathery berry scents. A meaty, fleshy palate is cut by sharp acidity, while this tastes of lightweight plum, berry and ginger. Lastly, a briny note seeps onto a grabby finish.

title: Delia 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Lean raspberry and orange peel aromas are low on fruit, while this feels pasty, sticky and grabby. Resiny oak creates vanilla-like lead flavors, with jammy berry fruit lurking in the background. A grabby-feeling, green finish tastes tart and feels scratchy.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2014 Reserva Unica  (Rioja)
description: There's a chemical note to the nose of this oaky-smelling Rioja. A thick palate is chewy and tannic, while this tastes of clove, licorice gumdrop and baked berry fruit. Oaky clove is the dominant flavor on a dense but standard finish.

title: Legaris 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Olive, forest floor and damp earth notes mix with berry and cassis aromas on the nose. It shows powerful tannins on the palate, with ripe black fruit flavors that reflect the warm vintage. Drink through 2024.

title: Casa Castillo 2013 Las Gravas Red (Jumilla)
description: This Monastrell-led blend smells like a pot of baked beans. A compact body is solid in the center but scratchy on the edges. Toasty, briary black-fruit flavors are herbal, and the wine tastes peppery and like tomato and oregano on the finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Altos de Torona 2018 Sobre Lías Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny aromas of orange and nectarine are a bit stony and minerally. This Albariño is plump but not real zesty. Melon and stone-fruit flavors finish creamy and fairly long due to lees aging.

title: Marco Abella 2013 Roca Roja Garnacha (Priorat)
description: Aromas of burnt wood and spice cover rugged gritty berry scents. This is a tight minerally wiry Garnacha that's oaky on the palate. Oak-rich plum flavors finish with strong tannins, residual grit and lasting wood-based notes. Drink through 2022.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Viñas de Paniza Oak Aged Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: Resiny oak aromas come with a chemical overtone, while this is dilute and wayward on the palate. Vanilla and bland white fruit flavors are strange and oaky on the finish.

title: Viña Palaciega 2017 Joven  (Rioja)
description: Stalky aromas of compost and mulchy berry fruits lead to a pulpy palate. Stalky, slightly green berry and plum flavors finish short with notes of raisin and desiccation.

title: Inurrieta 2017 Orchidea Sauvignon Blanc (Navarra)
description: Citrus- and pyrazine-based aromas of lime and bell pepper introduce this Navarran Sauvignon Blanc. It's simple and fresh, with bitter pepper and lime flavors.

title: Inazio Urruzola 2015 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Despite being the newest vintage, this smells oxidized and like briny apple. A lean palate ranks as bland, while flavors of sour apple and lemon peel finish tart and citric, with a lasting but discordant yeast-like flavor.

title: Castillo de Monjardin 2015 Crianza Origen Coupage Selección Red (Navarra)
description: A dark purple color and overripe raisin, berry and clove aromas introduce this Navarran blend. The palate is cloying and overweight, with wood resin and clove flavors. It finishes with that clove note, confirming its one-dimensional character.

title: García Figuero 2016 12 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Full, smoky blackberry and cassis aromas are concentrated and ripe. Typical of Ribera del Duero, this feels full and flush, with fierce tannins. Blackberry, coffee and chocolate flavors soften a bit on a firm finish that holds off on the hammer. Drink through 2030.

title: Montebuena 2016 Cuvée KPF Estate Bottled  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum, cherry and raspberry aromas comprise a level nose with a hint of green. On the palate, this is smacking but full, with wiry acidity. Plum and berry flavors finish well but short, without much follow-through.

title: Valdelacierva 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe and easygoing aromas of plum and berry fruits include a distant note of clove. This is juicy but also plump and balanced. Berry, plum and mild oak flavors are standard but appealing, while this is fresh, lightly oaky, spicy and correct on the finish.

title: Salcis 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Initial gritty aromas suggestive of coffee grounds give way to richer notes of molasses, leather and bretty berry fruit in this wine. Its full-bodied palate is ruled by choppy tannins and rugged plum and spice flavors. Those flavors lose clarity as oxidized notes settle in.

title: Elias Mora 2013 Gran  (Toro)
description: Cedar, charred oak and game are the key aromas in this wine. The palate is huge and tannic, with flavors of blackberry, cassis, baking spices and herbs that finish chocolaty and spicy. While the product of a cool vintage, this is still a saturated beast that could use more time to come around; drink through 2028.

title: Enate 2012 Merlot (Somontano)
description: Ripe, stout and smoky dark-berry aromas are spicy and a bit hot. This lush Merlot from a warm year is voluminous and chubby, with heft and full extraction. Spicy, toasty blackberry and cassis flavors come with chocolaty oak, while this is dense, chewy and mouth coating on the finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Portal del Montsant 2014 Brunus Red (Montsant)
description: A potpourri of floral red-fruit, dried herb and wet cement aromas lead to a racy fresh palate that's mildly complex. Oaky red-berry flavors come with a note of chocolate, while this tastes lightly herbal on a lasting well-formed finish. Drink this Carignan-Garnacha through 2021.

title: Can Sumoi 2018 Serra de L'Home Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: This Xarel-lo smells funky, with notes of compost. A fleshy palate is balanced by malic acidity, while this tastes of bitter nectarine and grape skins. A watery tasting finish feels grabby, tight and dry

title: Ramon Roqueta 2017 Tina 21 Garnacha Blanca (Catalunya)
description: Mild but clean and correct citrus aromas lead to a crisp, lip-smacking palate with decent body. Quick-hitting flavors of green fruit and white peach finish with zesty acidity and hints of orange peel and green herb. This is a white Grenache for simple sipping.

title: Grandes Vinos y Viñedos 2014 Monasterio de las Viñas Reserva Red (Cariñena)
description: Gently spiced plum and currant aromas come with a sprinkle of dusty earth. This blend of Garnacha, Tempranillo and Carignan feels tight and juicy, with acidity driving the palate. Lightly salty flavors of red plum and currant are fiery and come with an accent of oregano prior to a lean finish.

title: Forjas del Salnés 2017 Leirana Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's apple and melon aromas come with notes of wet wool and lanolin. The palate is bolstered by citrusy acidity that tastes solely of orange and orange peel. The finish is tangy and salty.

title: Eduardo Garrido García 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of tobacco, wood grain, plum and cherry set up a plucky, lively palate with hard tannins. Spicy plum and berry flavors finish steady and drawing. Drunk now through 2023.

title: Finca Río Negro 2015 992 Single Vineyard Cogolludo-Guadalajara Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: This blend of 80% Tempranillo and 20% Syrah features rubbery berry aromas suggestive of forced oak. The palate is grippy and mealy-feeling, with slightly oxidized berry flavors and a bland, rubbery finish.

title: Borsao 2017 Tres Picos Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Once upon a time, Tres Picos was one of the best value wines from Campo de Borja, but in recent years it has become nothing more than oaked-up commercial juice. Aromas of mint and clove dominate, while the mouthfeel is cloying and resiny. Clove and raw wood flavors carry over to the finish.

title: Cellers Baronia del Montsant 2013 Flor d'Englora Garnacha (Montsant)
description: Although this value red shows mild baked and raisiny aromas, it's not overripe. The palate is blocky but full. Dry oak flavors of clove and spice infuse its tomatoey plum fruit, feeling bold, dry and firm on the finish.

title: Pingao 2015  Rioja
description: This Rioja's gritty berry aromas include hints of pepper, asphalt and animal fur. It's clipped and raw, with oak-laden herbal plum and berry flavors. A burnt oak character rests heavily on the finish.

title: Torres 2013 Celeste Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty herbal aromas of olive, asphalt and compost announce a cool-vintage wine. This feels raw and massively tannic. Roasted barely ripe plum and berry flavors finish bone dry and pulling.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2015 Próximo  (Rioja)
description: Flat aromas of raisin and prune are dense but lack intensity. Matching the nose, this warm-vintage wine feels thick and a touch soupy. Plum, raisin and cassis flavors finish with hints of spice and cooked cherry and berry fruits.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2015 Joven Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Ripe roasted black-plum and berry aromas are wild and a touch hot. This is jumpy, angular and pumped to the brim with acidity. Foxy currant and red-plum flavors show a baking-spice element, while this is racy and rugged on the finish. Best for burgers and pizza.

title: Bodegas Carchelo 2012 Selecto Red (Jumilla)
description: Dense blackberry and cassis aromas show a hint of leather. This saturated jam-packed blend of Monastrell and several other red grapes tastes of chocolaty oak and baked plum and berries. A chunky finish doesn't show much evolution.

title: Vara 2017  Rioja
description: Cherry and black currant aromas are forward and grapy, while this feels a bit loose and pulpy. Black-plum flavors are nice but hollow, while this sees plum notes stick around on a soft finish.

title: Hidalgo 2016 Generación Ocho  (Ribera del Duero)
description: The first Hidalgo wine from Ribera del Duero that we've come across is concentrated, tannic, grinding and packed with fruit. Aromas of blackberry, maple and cassis are heady, while the palate on this young Tinto Fino is raw and rough. Blackberry, chocolate and woody flavors settle with gusto and some sophistication; best from 2022–2035.

title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2015 Gran Viu Red (Cariñena)
description: Aromas of maple, mocha, creamy oak and tree bark speak louder than fruit on this tight, rubbery feeling blend of Garnacha, Carignan and Tempranillo. Red plum, currant and spice flavors are touched up by chocolaty oak, while this reverts to choppy and extremely tannic on the finish.

title: Enate 2018 234 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: Oily citrus and stone fruit aromas smell a bit like household cleanser, while this Chardonnay feels healthy. Melon, apple and vanilla flavors finish with acidic kick, and while this tastes of vanilla and is suggestive of oak, this sees no wood and thus it's the lees that provide said character.

title: Martín Berdugo 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy black-fruit aromas open this fully built crianza. A tannic palate with cutting lemony acidity gives this a ton of energy. Berry and cassis flavors are equaled by oaky vanilla and café-mocha notes, while a coconut flavor and heat come up on the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Ramón Bilbao 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A heavy nose is oaked to the point that this Crianza smells mostly of charred wood and shoe polish. Oak-dominant flavors of herbal berry fruits and plum mixed with baking spices conclude with a resiny aftertaste.

title: Montserrat Canals Torres 2014 Eunoia Vintage Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Kiwi and lemon-lime aromas lead to a tight, stony palate. White-fruit flavors are more savory and briny than pure, while this evaporates and finishes with elegance. For a fresh style of cava, this brut nature rings true.

title: Legado del Moncayo 2016 Garnacha Blanca (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of clover and yeasty vanilla lack concentration. This feels a bit oily, while nonspecific citrus flavors finish with a note of grape skins and brine. It's acidic and medium to light in body.

title: Bodegas Lacort 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas are nicely spiced, and overall this reserva smells sound and mature. A tight, slightly choppy palate offers flavors of spiced plum, cherry, cola and cocoa. On the finish, this is steady but low on secondary flavors and complexity. Drink through 2022.

title: Finca Bacara 2015 Time Waits For No One Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: If time waits for no one, don't wait for this. A blocky, jumbled nose of charred and baked black fruits is rustic and off-base. Clove, all-spice and other savory flavors dominate a heavy, unbalanced finish.

title: La Antigua 2014 Clásico Blanco White (Rioja)
description: This yellow-colored wine has oaky, chemical aromas that lend an impression of tire rubber. Its wayward palate has oxidized apple and butter flavors that finish with notes of popcorn and brined kumquat.

title: Rafael Cambra 2014 Soplo Garnacha (Valencia)
description: Dry spice, bacon, rubber and red fruit aromas comprise the nose on this tight, prodding Garnacha with bright acidity. Red plum and pomegranate flavors finish with a note of salt on a long finish with raspberry shadings.

title: Carlos Moro 2014 Finca Valmediano 16 Meses Barrica  (Toro)
description: The intensely ripe berry and cassis aromas in this single-vineyard Toro come with strong tobacco and baking spice side notes. The palate is loaded to the brim with tobacco, coconut, blackberry and cassis flavors, finishing rich and chocolatey. Drink through 2028.

title: Marques Escriba 2018 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Marshmallow, milk-chocolate and grassy berry aromas feed into a sappy palate that's sticky and confected. Clove and milk-chocolate flavors dominate, while this feels quite heavy on the finish.

title: CVNE 2016 Viña Real Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A tight nose with clamp and aromas of field greens and alfalfa could use more fruit, while this crianza feels grabby and tannic. Berry flavors are spicy but lean toward green, while this tastes minty and feels scratchy on the finish.

title: Altos De Rioja 2015 Altos R Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Chunky black fruit aromas are inviting and under control. In the mouth, this crianza from a warm, dry vintage feels thick and saturated, with jammy weight. Roasted berry and plum flavors finish big, sappy and a touch jagged due to rugged tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: El Escocés Volante 2013 Es Lo Que Hay Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Spain)
designation: Es Lo Que Hay Viñas Viejas
description: Stewed, mealy berry fruit aromas are lacking in clarity and quality. This Garnacha from a cool year feels lean and raw, while berry flavors are sour, weedy and devoid of ripeness. A scratchy, earthy tasting finish is not of help.

title: Energo 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Initial ripe, baked black fruit aromas transition to raisiny. A heavy, smacking palate steps with heavy feet, while this tastes of roasted black plum and stewed berry fruits. A chewy, dense, saturated finish is par for the course.

title: Sedosa 2015 Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Clean, stony aromas are more neutral than fruity. This feels good and standard, with fresh acidity. Mild flavors of citrus, stone fruits and yeast fade quickly on the finish.

title: Portal del Priorat 2013 Gotes del Montsant Carignan-Grenache (Montsant)
description: Aromas of wet cement, plum, blueberry and cherry come with moderate oak. This feels wide and grabby, with no definitive focal point. Spicy earthy slightly exotic berry and plum flavors finish with grabby tannins and juicy acidity.

title: Hacienda del Carche 2015 Taus Selección Red (Jumilla)
description: Sunbaked plum and currant aromas are a touch spicy. In the mouth, this blend of 50% Monastrell, 25% Syrah and 25% Cabernet Sauvignon is full, tannic and mostly well balanced. Dense spicy plume and black-fruit plum flavors finish with rubbery grabby tannins.

title: Terroir Al Límit 2015 Terra de Cuques White (Priorat)
description: Dusty, peachy aromas are mellow, while overall not a lot is happening on the nose. A somewhat collapsed, fallen palate is ultimately a bit flat. Mild apple and spice flavors last on a finish that's slightly bitter and tastes of almond.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2018 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Aromas of white fruits and apple skins are clean and fresh. A zesty palate is crisp and minerally, with a hint of spritz. Typical Godello flavors of melon and apple are steady on the finish.

title: Torres 2014 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)
description: The nose of this wine is melony and chunky, with a touch of oak. The palate feels solid enough but still a bit mushy, while dry, creamy flavors of tropical fruits are diffuse in front of a finish that's low in verve.

title: Viña Mayor 2015 El Secreto  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of blueberry, blackberry and oaky cinnamon set up a powerful palate that doesn't shy away from anything. Black fruit flavors are rugged and hold the oak well, while this is huge on the finish but forgiving due to great overall balance. Drink through 2028.

title: Altolandon 2013 Rayuelo Bobal (Manchuela)
description: This Bobal's roasted berry and funky animal aromas hardly lay down the red carpet. Its dry spice and oak flavors smother berry and plum fruit, tasting herbal and minty on a heavy, grippy finish.

title: Castillo Clavijo 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Familiar Rioja aromas of cigar box, baking spices and dried cherry introduce a dense, sinewy palate. Flavors of cherry, plum and chocolate include peppery spice notes, which are balanced on the way out.

title: Vega Sauco 2015 Piedras & Princesas  (Toro)
description: There are more piedras (rocks) to this than princesas (princesses). The nose is ripe but a bit chemical, while the palate throbs with aggressive tannins and grinding acidity. Berry and chocolate flavors are fiery, and overall this is more high octane than anything else.

title: Naveran 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Aromas of orange and vanilla turn more burnt and smoky as this Pinot Noir-Parellada brut rosé opens up. The highly foamy mouthfeel carries rustic, spicy citrus flavors.

title: Viore 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This wine's punchy citrus, pineapple and pyrazine aromas lead to a steady but shy palate with adequate acidity. Its mix of tropical fruit and green citrus flavors finishes slightly bitter.

title: Marques de Tomares 2011 Monteleiva Reserva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia  (Rioja)
designation: Monteleiva Reserva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia
description: Fully ripe black fruit aromas are slightly raisiny and a touch flat. On the palate, this reserva from a hot year is weighted down by rubbery tannins and ripe berry fruit. Flavors of prune and raisin are at the core of a slightly overripe flavor profile, while this remains full on the finish.

title: Naveran 2016 Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Lavender-scented soap and talcum-powder aromas are light and airy. This brut nature feels austere and citric. Sour orange and melon flavors are a bit stale, while this tastes of underripe cantaloupe on the finish.

title: Marqués de Montañana 2015 Selección Especial Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Jumpy foxy berry aromas get this Garnacha going. Raw hard tannins smack down with ferocity, while this tastes of candied plum, salt, chocolate and something oddly artificial. Dry scratchy tannins make for a rough finish.

title: Portal del Priorat 2016 Gotes Grenache-Carignan (Priorat)
description: Dry, peppery cassis and blackberry aromas are a high point on this Garnacha-Carignan blend because the palate is highly tartaric and angular. Tart plum and wiry currant flavors are narrow, pinching and severely dry on the finish.

title: Terras Gauda 2016 Abadía de San Campio Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Moderately floral aromas of stone fruits and fresh carrot juice feed into a round palate that's balanced and well shaped. Nectarine and peach flavors are nice and easy. This wine is slightly leesy-tasting on a medium-length finish.

title: Campo Viejo 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dry, spicy aromas of plum, brick dust and earth are lean but sound. On the palate, this Rioja is plenty satisfying, with smooth tannins. Plum and wild berry flavors finish tight, tannic and peppery, with moderate oak in support.

title: Bodegas Luzón 2013 Luzón Roble Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: This Monastrell's cherry and cassis aromas show a rough, oaky burn. It's grippy and a touch raw on the palate, with roasted berry and plum flavors that linger into the finish.

title: Alion 2013 Alion  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Some years, even the top wines suffer, and in a cold 2013, Alion is not what it normally is. For starters, this is far more tight, tannic, raw and pulling than its track record. Toasty oak is a big player, creating creamy aromas and toast on the finish. In between are crisp, peppery blackberry flavors. This wine may improve with time. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Marques de Monistrol 2013 Premium Cuvée Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Bready lightly oxidized aromas and a gold color are not overly encouraging. A mostly lifeless palate is pickled and tastes of brined citrus fruits, while a dry hollow finish is the ending.

title: Carlos Serres 2018 Old Vines  (Rioja)
description: Foxy plum and cherry aromas come with a hint of minty green. On the palate, this standard Tempranillo feels choppy and edgy, without much middle ground. Plum and herbal flavors finish dry, with freshness and a note of latent oak.

title: Ignacio Marín 2015 Wine Wings Moscatel-Garnacha White (Cariñena)
description: Tropical aromas of lychee are about all that stand out on the nose of this unusual Moscatel-Garnacha Blanca blend. Neither dry nor sweet, this seems caught in no man's land. A dilute mouthfeel and bitter pyrazine notes on the finish don't help this along.

title: Quintana de Cue 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Heavy berry fruit and oak aromas are low on depth and complexity. This thick Tempranillo is choppy and impermeable. Saucy flavors of herbal plum and tomato finish equally herbal and with saltiness, much like a meat sauce for pasta.

title: Gotas de Mar 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: The integrated nose with peach, melon and stony aromas is clean and vital. This weighs in on the full, round and heavy side, while flavors of orange and grapefruit are good but monotone. A briny citrusy finish closes this out. Drink now.

title: Marqués del Turia 2018 Viura-Sauvignon Blanc (Valencia)
description: Tropical-fruit aromas lead this light-bodied blend of Viura and Sauvignon Blanc. It is lean in feel, with lime-like acidity. Tropical-fruit flavors finish mild and easy.

title: Alta Alella 2017 Lanius White (Alella)
description: A golden color and oily aromas of honey, walnut, lightly oxidized citrus and wood grain announce this chunky but sturdy Catalonian white blend. Oak is the lead flavor, backed by butter and roast pumpkin and/or squash. A warm, full finish closes out this barrel-aged number. Drink now.

title: Bodega Carmen Rodríguez 2015 Carodorum Issos Crianza  (Toro)
description: Leathery berry aromas include exotic notes that stir interest. This feels choppy but also lively and balanced. Cassis, blackberry and plum flavors finish steady. With plenty of ripeness and depth, this manages to show complexity along with elegance. Drink through 2020.

title: Dominio de la Abadesa 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Heavy pyrazines on the nose result in green aromas of cactus along with sulfur and matchstick. This feels plump and pulpy, with no spine or structure. Core melon and tropical fruit flavors are yeasty prior to a finish that's oddly creamy.

title: Santo Cristo 2016 Flor de Añon Verdejo (Campo de Borja)
description: This offers light aromas of yeasty white flowers and lemon-lime. The palate is weak, while generic white-fruit flavors fall off quickly and taste oxidized on a bready finish.

title: Portal del Priorat 2015 Ediciones I Limitadas Luno Red (Montsant)
description: Earthy berry and animal aromas are challenging, while this Garnacha-led blend feels flat and obtuse, with little lift of layering. Reduced, jammy plum and blueberry flavors finish with rubbing tannins and heat that builds.

title: Gómez de Segura 2013 Finca Ratón Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cottony plum and berry aromas are a touch soapy. This is plodding and on the heavy side. Saturated stewy berry and spice flavors are chocolaty and oaky on the finish, as well as herbal. This offers a lot, but it's coarse, jumpy and suffers a bit under its own weight.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Clos Dalian Crianza Grenache (Terra Alta)
description: This is tight and rubbery in feel, without much depth or give to the palate. Herbal tea aromas accent generic red fruit scents. Raspberry, red plum and salty flavors finish choppy but clean.

title: Protos 2015 27  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's raisin and prune aromas are accented by marzipan, tobacco and oak notes. Ripe flavors of blackberry and raisin are offset by citrusy acidity, creating rawness on an otherwise concentrated palate. It's extracted, acidic and a bit disjointed on the finish.

title: Barahonda 2015 Barrica Monastrell-Syrah (Yecla)
description: A roasted, rubbery nose deals a proprietary mix of savory blueberry, tea and grassy hints. In the mouth, this red blend is raw and pulls inward. Minty, herbal berry flavors are green at heart, while any fruit this has is short-lived on an herbal finish.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Aragus Made with Organic Grapes Red (Campo de Borja)
description: This chewy Garnacha has grapy berry and cherry aromas that seem the slightest bit chemical. It's medium in body, with blackberry and cassis flavors and a prune-like, rubbery finish.

title: Finca Albret 2013 Reserva Red (Navarra)
description: Raisiny berry aromas are jumpy and foxy as well. In the mouth, this feels dry like desiccated fruits. Black plum, oak and vanilla flavors finish flush and full but also tough and intense. Five years after harvest and this is no easy ride.

title: Muruve 2016 Joven  (Toro)
description: Rubbery, medicinal berry aromas smell like Pepto-Bismol. A chunky palate is big and blocky, with no elegance or charm. Candied, grapy flavors finish hard and scratchy.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2013 Conde Valdemar Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Raisin and prune aromas announce a chunky palate that's solid but not agile or elegant. Flavors of prune and cassis come with a sense of grape skins. It finishes well.

title: Vega Sauco 2015 el Beybi  (Toro)
description: Raisiny aromas are obvious but not over the top. This basic Toro is expansive but a touch heavy in fell. Raisin and black plum flavors are more baked than fresh, while this is compact on the finish.

title: Sonsierra 2012 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dry berry, rose petal and leafy notes get this gran reserva going. In this youthful state, pulling acidity is making this raw on the palate. Currant, red plum and cranberry flavors loosen up on a steady finish. This is not a classic Rioja gran reserva; it's fresher and less complex than the classic recipe calls for; drink through 2022.

title: Acentor 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Berry and tomato aromas are basic. Typical of Garnacha, this is grabby and chewy on the palate. Flavors of grape skins, black plum and herbal berry fruits are peppery and show a hint of oak-based clove on the finish.

title: Volver 2015 Tarima Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Toast and leather aromas support modest berry scents. This is full, loud and banging on the palate. Roasted blackened flavors of blackberry and plum carry a meaty note, while this remains dark and toasty on an aggressive finish.

title: Monterebro 2015 Blanco Sauvignon Blanc (Jumilla)
description: Jumilla is a red-wine region, but this Sauvignon Blanc is a citrusy example of a tastyquaffable white from the area. Aromas of citrus peel are mildly pyrazinic, while this feels plump and balanced, but with spritz. Core citrus flavors come with a sprinkle of salt.

title: Pago de la Jaraba 2014 Red (La Mancha)
description: A cool, minty, rubbery nose revolves around smoky berry aromas. This is mostly Tempranillo, with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Merlot, and on the palate it bounces from point to point. A short blast of blackberry and plum flavors finishes with power, acidity and a gamy quality.

title: Covila 2010 II Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas are sweetened by notes of raisin, creamy oak and root beer. This gran reserva is more easygoing, plump and chunky than what you'd expect from a great vintage like 2010, with flavors of tobacco, woodspice, vanilla, cherry and berry fruit. Cocoa is a prime flavor on the finish. Drink now through 2023.

title: Neo 2014 Punta Esencia  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smoky oak aromas sit atop berry and cassis scents on what amounts to a classic RDD nose. A clampy palate is tannic and tough, while this tastes of oak-driven chocolate, baked black fruits and raisin. A strong oak element persists on a ripe finish with vanilla and prune notes. Drink through 2025.

title: Gotas de Mar 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny white-fruit aromas are lean, with a pyrazinic note of jalapeño. Stone fruit flavors show on the palate, but with a mild bitterness. Nectarine is the lead on a short-run finish. Drink now.

title: Ego Bodegas 2017 Acuma Red (Jumilla)
description: Bearish from the beginning, this Monastrell-Syrah-Petit Verdot shows mossy berry and charred aromas in front of a hard choppy palate, with gravelly tannins. Burnt oak, savory spice and woody black-fruit flavors give way to nothing but overpowering char and oak grain on the finish.

title: Celler Pasanau 2012 Finca La Planeta Red (Priorat)
description: Crisp, focused aromas of ripe berry fruits, hot asphalt and spice are potent and excellent. From one of the Priorat's highest locales (2,400 feet), this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Garnacha tastes of spicy plum, crushed peppercorn and schist. Warm finishing notes of minerality combined with strong fruit flavors are thorough and complex; drink through 2028.

title: Rioja Vega 2008 Gran Reserva Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of cola, raisin and cassis are ripe and chunky. A sinewy palate displays raisiny flatness, while this is oaky tasting on the surface and more spicy, rubbery and fruity underneath. Flavors of tobacco and wood spice finish tight, with bright acidity keeping things lively.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2015 Finca Alto Cantabria Macabeo (Rioja)
description: A yellowish tint and woody aromas include a note of baked apple. A somewhat full-bodied palate is endowed with a resiny texture, while this tastes of woody dried apple and papaya. Round and persistently oaky on the finish.

title: Torres 2015 Celeste Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cool, murky berry aromas are gamy. A blast of fruitiness propels a big palate loaded with spicy chocolaty oak. Bold berry flavors are short-lasting on a tight, intense finish. Crianzas are made to drink young, but this will benefit from more aging; drink through 2028.
