title: Pingón 2014 Torre Pingón Selección  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy berry aromas are loaded with gritty notes of black olive and coffee grounds, meaning the nose is none too bright. A choppy palate is rough and drawing, while this tastes of soy sauce, pepper and dark berry fruits. A tough drying jagged finish lowers the smoothness factor on this hard-pounding RDD. Drink through 2030.

title: Martín Berdugo 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Floral aromas mixed with citrus notes are appealing. This wine feels round but solidified by bright core acidity. Ripe flavors include pineapple, mango and peach. On the finish, lime and tropical notes are good but short.

title: Castaño 2016 Alcaria Red (Yecla)
description: This blend of Monastrell, Syrah and Garnacha Tintorera feels lively, its dark plum and berry aromas laced with chocolate. Smacking tannins create a dry sensation, framing ripe black plum and prune flavors. Complex notes of spice and tomato emerge on the firm finish.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2016 Blanco Macabeo (Jumilla)
description: Grapefruit, peach and flowery aromas amount to a pleasant wine. This varietal Macabeo feels oily but it also has citric snap. Pineapple, grapefruit and salty flavors finish lemony fresh.

title: Finca la Melonera 2015 La Encina del Inglés White (Málaga)
description: Honeyed aromas of orange marmalade lead to a flat palate. Bitter flavors of melon and almond skins confirm that this oddball blend of Moscatel, Doradilla and PX from the mountains outside Málaga is lackluster.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Garnacha Rosé (Cariñena)
description: This wine's oily citrus and petrol aromas recall certain Rieslings. It's round palate on the palate, with citrusy acidity but little edge. Its modest grapefruit flavors are short and slightly oxidized and bitter.

title: Peñalba Herraiz 2014 Carravid  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe, meaty aromas of black fruit and oak announce a well-made wine with nice balance between ripeness and structure. Its creamy and a bit thick on the palate, offset by hard tannins. It finishes with chocolaty oak and savory berry flavors. Drink this serious red through 2026.

title: Pago de la Jaraba 2017 Viña Jaraba Cosecha Viñedos Propios Unfiltered Red (La Mancha)
designation: Viña Jaraba Cosecha Viñedos Propios Unfiltered
description: Baked aromas include raisin and marshmallow. A collapsed palate follows the nose, while this tastes mostly of raisin and prune. A soft finish confirms that this is alarmingly low on both freshness and structure.

title: Finca Arantei 2016 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Lemon-drop aromas are fresh and show a touch of green apple. This wine is solid, but a bit basic. Lightly salted melon and apricot flavors finish dry and collected.

title: Finca Antigua 2017 Sobre Lías Viura (La Mancha)
description: This Viura, aged five months on the lees, has wayward, blowsy vanilla and spun sugar aromas and no focal point on the palate. Its yeasty white fruit flavors are strange, unfamiliar and shapeless.

title: Conde de Siruela 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This impresses with bold berry and spice aromas. On the palate, it's wiry in feel, with pounding acidity and hard tannins. Its salty, earthy plum and red berry flavors are fully oaked, with a severely dry and high-acid finish. Drink through 2027.

title: Mocén 2014 Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This gold-colorerd wine has fruitless, oaky aromas of squash and pumpkin. It feels flabby, with a resiny oak component to the mouthfeel. Flavors faded if not slightly spoiled white fruits finish with a loud echo of oak.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2014 Amancio  (Rioja)
description: A fleshy nose is ripe but stolid, with mild dark-fruit aromas along with charred, toasty hints. A full palate shows scratchy tannins and flavors of dark fruits, mocha and lemony oak. Baked berry flavors linger on an oaky finish with rubbing tannins. Keep in mind that 2014 was a damp vintage, so this deserves extra credit.

title: Maurodos 2014 San Román  (Toro)
description: This wine shows a heady, toasty nose of black-fruit aromas, along with maple, spice and heat notes. Spiced blackberry and cassis flavors are typical of this Tinta de Toro, however a palate that's rough as sandpaper makes this a tough go. Drink through 2025.

title: Val de Los Frailes 2015 Pago de las Costanas Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Rooty aromas of vanilla, turned earth, pepper and berry fruits are comfortable and congruent. While this is smacking on the palate, spicy plum and currant flavors are high in quality. On the finish, this tastes of oak grain and spice, but in a good way. Drink through 2028.

title: Bodegas Leda 2015 Viñas Viejas Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Dense raisin and blackberry aromas tilt this in the direction of overripe. On the full, beefy palate, grating tannins frame spicy prune and cassis flavors. A heavy, tannic finish confirms the wine's overtly ripe character, with toasty oak influence.

title: Luzia de Ripa 2015  Txakoli de Álava
description: Cidery aromas are, at best, sturdy. This has shearing acidity along with an oily round mouthfeel. Sour stone-fruit and citrus flavors finish with lasting notes of tart green apple. This is a still Txakoli: don't expect spritz or bubbles.

title: Conde de Altava 2015  Rioja
description: Jumpy raspberry and candied plum aromas are akin to Kool-Aid. A rubbery, grabby palate and foxy, medicinal flavors of latex and berry fruits culminate on a strained finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Reserva de la Familia Sparkling (Cava)
description: This fits properly into the brut nature category courtesy of neutral aromas and a direct tightly built palate. Mild citrus and melon flavors lose some clarity on a finish that hints at mealy apple and butter.

title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2017 Menguante Garnacha Blanca (Cariñena)
description: Early aromas of honeyed melon are as good as this Garnacha Blanca gets. A pulpy palate with no back end houses orange-like flavors that turn bitter on the finish.

title: Sonsierra 2016  Rioja
description: Aromas of road tar, blackberry and rubber are a touch chemical but not bad. A raw palate with rubbery tannins is home to generic plum and berry flavors. A dry rubbery-feeling finish is appropriate for this everyday Tempranillo.

title: Marco Abella 2013 Loidana Red (Priorat)
description: Fresh cherry and plum aromas are basic and easy, with a medicinal side note. This Garnacha-Carignan-Cabernet blend is grabby and pulling. Plum, raspberry and tomato flavors finish with a reprise of rubbery tannins.

title: Alidis 2012 VS  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas are backed by strong oak that yields a touch of clove. A deep and layered palate is balanced and mostly fresh, which aids a full-bodied Tempranillo such as this. Black-plum, cassis and spice flavors finish with savory complexity. This is a big ripe offering to drink through 2028.

title: Olivier Rivière 2015 Ganko  (Rioja)
description: Here's another raring red from Bordeaux-born Rivière that needs time to settle. Ripe aromas are all about fruit, while this wine is clamping on the palate, with a sense of skins one hopes will resolve with time. Peppery plum and wild berry flavors finish with cheek-grabbing tannins and lasting toastiness. Drink 2019–2035.

title: Guerra 2014 De Pura Cepa Roble Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Generic cherry, berry and spice aromas make for a solid nose. This Mencía is fleshy but lacking in depth and intensity. Plum, currant and cherry flavors are diluted on the finish.

title: Bodegas Murviedro 2013 Cepas Viejas Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Berry and earth aromas open with a touch of horseradish that blows off with time. This Bobal is drawing and dry on the palate, with fresh acidity. Savory berry and tomato flavors finish with scratchy tannins.

title: Ignacio Marín 2015 Old Vines Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Ripe, dark blackberry aromas border on prune. A fleshy, full palate offers layering and tannic structure, while this old vines Garnacha tastes toasty and heavily oaked, with blackberry flavors resting comfortably under a woody blanket. Coffee, chocolate and tobacco flavors are ramped up on a hot finish.

title: 12 Linajes 2016 Crianza Tempranillo  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Bold berry fruit and oaky vanilla aromas are integrated and inviting. In the mouth, this crianza from a strong vintage feels deep, flush and layered, with firm tannins. Blackberry and black currant flavors don't go much further on a staunch finish. Drink this steady crianza over the next few years.

title: Val de Los Frailes 2016 Rosado (Cigales)
description: This blend of Tempranillo and Verdejo feels chunky. It shows jumbled vinegar and rubber aromas and briny citrus flavors that add a bit of character to the finish.

title: Bodegas Perica 2015 Olsgosa Viura (Rioja)
description: Warm dusty oaky aromas come prior to a citric palate that's high in acidity and thus austere. Salty citrus flavors are monotone and fail to alter path on a salty woody finish.

title: CVNE 2013 Cune Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas are adequate but not the stuff of legend. In the mouth, this off-vintage gran reserva is solid but a bit jagged and choppy. Warm, earthy plum and berry flavors come with a mild chocolate backing prior to a balanced finish. Given the difficulties of 2013, namely extended cold weather, this is commendable. Drink through 2030.

title: Castell d'Encus 2015 Ekam White (Costers del Segre)
description: A blast of petrol opens this blend of Riesling and Albariño from the Pyrenees. After the harshness blows off, this displays a citric personality and stony minerality. Ripe white-fruit flavors are offset by a yeasty finish. Drink now.

title: Josep Grau Viticultor 2015 L'Efecte Volador Red (Montsant)
description: Hot rubbery untamed aromas need help. This Syrah-led blend feels clampy and rough. Salty murky black-fruit flavors are herbal and wild, and there's no help coming on the finish, which is grabby.

title: Pradorey 2016 Tempranillo-Merlot Fermentado en Barrica Rosado (Ribera del Duero)
description: This red-colored barrel-fermented rosé of Tempranillo and Merlot smells funky and gummy. Flat on the palate, this tastes of pickled red cabbage: charmless and difficult to get through.

title: Naveran 2014 Perles Blanques Cuvée Antonia Sparkling (Cava)
description: Toasty smoky aromas of well-oaked base wine stick out on this vintage Cava. A round, solid palate is balanced and shows proper grip, while this tastes pickled and slightly bitter as opposed to fresh and pure. Briny flavors linger on a smooth finish.

title: Heras Cordon 2012 Hacienda José Luis Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This wine's heavy black fruit aromas lack freshness. The palate is similar: it's both stewy and tannic. Its raisiny black fruit flavors are buried in oak, tasting much like a cup of black coffee on the hot, heavy finish. It's too overripe and bulky, even for the warm year.

title: Montebaco 2017 Alma de Vino Mar y Montaña White (Ribeiro)
designation: Alma de Vino Mar y Montaña
description: Simple aromas of apple and generic white fruits lead to a chunky palate with just enough vitality and acidity. Fleshy apple and peach flavors are modest in front of a short finish that lacks punch. Drink now.

title: Love 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: There isn't much to love about this weedy abrasive high-acid Tempranillo. Green and grassy in flavor, with a minty acidic finish, this is barely cutting it as a whole.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2016 Viña Pomal Rosé (Rioja)
description: A harsh nose smells more of gasoline than fruit. This is rubbery and astringent in feel. Yeasty flavors of papaya are tired, while this tastes of white bread on a finish without much snap.

title: Uro 2011 Selección  (Toro)
description: Ripe toasty chocolaty aromas of prune and fig turn more volatile and jumpy with air. A tight perky palate with bold tartaric acidity is home to flavors of oak, vanilla, tobacco and spicy plum and berry fruits. Flavors of mocha and chocolate-chip cookie soften up an otherwise intense finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Atalayas de Golbán 2016 Virdiana Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jammy berry and cotton candy aromas are a bit hot and weedy. This feels sappy but upright on the palate. Flavors of plum, currant and green herbs finish with grip and spice notes.

title: Coto de Hayas 2014 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Campo de Borja)
description: Clove and beef jerky aromas are odd and forceful. A globular palate lacks form and balance, while this tastes oddly and singularly of clove.

title: Bodegas Vegalfaro 2014 Pago de los Balagueses Syrah (Spain)
description: Smoky, blackened aromas take their lead from heavy oak, which makes for a resiny, foresty nose with blackberry scents. This Syrah is saturated and full-tilt in feel. Clove, toast and blackberry flavors finish oaky and spicy. This woody monster needs time to settle and absorb more oak; drink through 2023.

title: Ipsum 2017 Estate Bottled Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This wine's citrus and mango aromas come with a shot of green bell pepper—all atypical notes for Rueda. Its plump but watery palate holds bell pepper, green banana and lime flavors. A capsicum-tasting burn dominates the finish.

title: Olivier Rivière 2015 Mirando al Sur Viura (Rioja)
description: Heavy oak gives off sawmill aromas, with only touches of apple and stone-fruit scents lurking below the surface. This feels creamy, heavy and striving for balance. With a ton of oak flavor leading the charge, it tastes woody, candied and spicy, but also jumbled and unfamiliar.

title: La Bodega de Pinoso 2016 Vergel Rosado (Alicante)
description: Fresh, composed aromas suggest a stick of fruit-flavored chewing gum. This wine has a pulpy palate and a hint of spritz that makes it tastes soda-like, with red-apple flavors and a touch of peppery bitterness.

title: Altanza 2010 Sorolla Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Tar, smoky plum and berry aromas are fine but light on complexity and elegance. This feels tight, with edgy tannins, while roasted plum flavors finish short on depth. For a high-end Reserva from a great vintage, this is just good enough to recommend.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2014 Dulce Blanco Macabeo (Jumilla)
description: Aromas of buttered noodles and honey fail to hold up in the glass. This sweet Macabeo feels a bit watery, with no complexity to the palate structure. Flavors of honey and vanilla are slightly bitter.

title: Palacio de Fefiñanes 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Fefiñanes ranks among the best and most consistent makers of Albariño in Rías Baixas, so no surprise that this comes across clean on the nose, with lively notes of white fruits and buttercup. A plump but vibrant palate is still in peak condition, while this tastes of nectarine, apple, honeydew and lime. Drink through 2019.

title: Matarromera 2016 Granza Made From Organic Grapes  (Ribera del Duero)
description: The electric-purple color and foxy aromas of syrupy berry fruits and yeast should put you on red alert. In the mouth, this is heavy, overly acidic and rock-hard in terms of tannins. Grapy sour stunted flavors match the color, aromas and mouthfeel.

title: Bodegas Corral 2016 Don Jacobo Viura (Rioja)
description: This wine is citrus-driven on the nose, leading to a streamlined palate of apple, green melon and almond skin flavors.

title: Marqués de Vargas 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A dark color and warm aromas of plum, raisin and prune announce a fuller-bodied wine. In the mouth, this feels sappy and extracted, while black cherry and prune flavors are darker and fatter than what you find in most crianzas. On the finish, dark-fruit notes quickly give way to prune.

title: Real De Aragón 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Citrus peel and briary berry aromas are proprietary rather than common to most Garnacha wines from Calatayud. A flush palate offers both vibrant acidity and hard tannins. Plum, raspberry and exotic spice flavors wind down on a racy, aggressive finish.

title: CVNE 2011 Viña Real Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy plum and berry aromas are slightly earthy and on the money. This feels full and plump, but well balanced. Spicy dry plum and berry flavors are limited but focused, while this offers a vanilla note on a finish that fades out slow and easy. Drink through 2019.

title: Baron De Ley 2018 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Melon and nectarine aromas are open and easygoing. On the palate, this is more lean and simple than pulpy. Mild stone fruit flavors are steady and cleansing and don't make noise; made entirely from Garnacha grapes.

title: Teso La Monja 2017 Romanico  (Toro)
description: Blackberry and blueberry aromas are full and spicy like pie. This Toro is big and extracted, with road-grating tannins. Toasty, blackened berry flavors are ripe and rugged, while this is ramming in feel and toasty in flavor on the finish.

title: Viña Eguía 2014  Rioja
description: Plum, raspberry and floral aromas create an appealing nose. This everyday Rioja feels tight and pulling, with scratchy tannins. A flavor profile dominated by red berries feels tannic and rubbery on the finish.

title: Breca 2016 Garnacha De Fuego Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Flat berry aromas are pretty heavy, while this Garnacha is so full in body that it's a bit over the top for what it is. Ripe, candied flavors of baked black fruits and chocolate finish with bulk.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2017 Fermentado en Barrica Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: This Chardonnay's floral aromas are inoffensive but not very wine-like. The palate is round but hollow in the middle, with briny citrus flavors and mustard- and green herb-inflected finish.

title: Matarromera 2016 Granza Made From Organic Grapes Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Tropical mango, melon, citrus and peach-pit aromas are typical for Verdejo. Flavors of citrus peel and stone-fruit pits follow the nose, while this organic-grape offering is mildly green on a light fresh finish.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2016 Roble Graciano (Navarra)
description: Raw reedy red-fruit aromas are scratchy and herbal. Given that, it's not a surprise that this Graciano is clampy on the palate. A mix of sweet and savory flavors includes red currant, pomegranate and tomato, while this is linear and doesn't generate much excitement on the finish.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2018 Satinela Medium Sweet White (Rioja)
description: Mild apple and peach aromas are neither bad nor good, just simple and giving off a hint of pyrazines. A full, oily palate is almost viscous, while this tastes of melon and sugary stone fruits.

title: Beso de Vino 2016 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Gamy briny berry aromas are undistinguished. This basic Garnacha feels pointy and tannic. Flavors of currant and prickly red plum show a green note on an herbal finish that's flimsy in structure.

title: Senda Verde 2018 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: An empty nose followed by a palate suggestive of fruit pulp cut by saline water gets this started. Jumbled flavors of passion fruit and overripe stone fruits culminate on a flabby finish. This is worth one glass, maybe two.

title: Proelio 2015 Cepa a Cepa  (Rioja)
description: This wine's richly oaked blackberry and cassis aromas include hints of tobacco and sawdust. Its saturated palate is hard with rubbery tannins, suggesting it needs time to age. Its oaky, inky black fruit flavors finish toasty and dark, with tobacco and cigar box notes. Drink 2021–2038.

title: Muga 2018 Flor De Muga Rosé (Rioja)
description: A yeasty note of cured ham is noted on this lightly oaked high-end Rioja rosé. A fresh palate, with a woody texture, offers flavors of oak grain, peach and cantaloupe prior to a steady, fresh finish that reverberates with oak and minerally notes.

title: Resalte 2014 Lecco Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas border on raisiny and stewed, while background notes of graphite and smoke are barrel driven. This crianza from a marginal vintage feels resiny and a bit syrupy. Savory black fruit flavors come with vanilla and chocolate shadings, while this remains chocolaty on a steady finish.

title: Txakoli Primo 2018 Zarautz Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Almost no color and lightly tropical aromas of melon and lime are underwhelming. This lean Txakoli owns a soda-like disposition, with flavors of lemon-lime soda that finish dry and stony.

title: Portal del Priorat 2015 Tros de Clos Carignan (Priorat)
description: Earthy blackberry aromas include a gaseous note as well as hints of black olive and spice cake. While big as an ox, this varietal Carignan is also bumpy and incongruous on the palate. Sappy black-plum and berry flavors include vanilla and lemony oak notes in front of a drawing finish with savory tobacco accents. Drink this warm-vintage Priorat red through 2022.

title: Vicente Gandia 2015 Finca Del Mar Crianza Tempranillo (Valencia)
description: Cherry and red currant aromas are compact, with notes of wet earth and damp animal fur. A reduced palate is drawing, while this shows narrow black fruit and peppery flavors in front of a sappy finish that hollows out little by little.

title: Matanegra 2012 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty berry aromas come in front of a clampy palate that's acidic then tannic and ultimately empty. Chunky berry and vanilla flavors struggle to stay steady on a finish that doesn't improve or devolve.

title: CVNE 2014 Viña Real Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Traditional Rioja aromas of dried berry fruit and red currant are rugged. In the mouth, this is dry, pulling and fairly austere due to grinding tannins. Gritty flavors of plum and tomato sauce are spicy and the slightest bit green on the finish. Drink or hold through 2021.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2017 VII  (Rioja)
description: Stalky aromas play towards rhubarb, while this is hard and tannic on the palate. Grassy, stalky plum flavors lack ripeness and concentration.

title: Latúe 2018 Made with Organic Grapes Airen (La Mancha)
description: A clear, almost colorless tint and stalky aromas open this varietal Airén that's more flaccid than lively. A mix of green-fruit and lightly bitter flavors finishes short and without much power or purpose.

title: Raventós de Alella 2017 Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: Yeasty apple aromas are a bit harsh and muddled, while this varietal Xarel-lo feels plump, pulpy and chunky. Earthy, murky apple flavors finish flat and with a grape skins flavor.

title: Luna Beberide 2015 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Mild apple and white-fruit aromas are a bit wheaty like bread. Conversely, the palate is tight, with pulling lemony acidity. Like the nose, this tastes wheaty and like stone fruits, while the finish is distinctly leesy.

title: Clos de Nit 2017 Red (Montsant)
description: Pulpy, grapy berry aromas are moderately concentrated. This blend of Garnacha, Carignan and three other red grapes feels grabby and pulpy, while flavors of blackberry and raspberry are slightly minty and herbal. Crisp tannins keep the finish in line.

title: Alidis 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Dark smoky, stout aromas of licorice, molasses and blackberry feed into a jammy palate with rock-hard, clamping tannins. Plum, blackberry and blueberry flavors are loud and intense, while this finishes with density, complexity, chewy tannins and a jammy essence. Drink through 2028.

title: Viña Eguía 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy, savory oak aromas sit in front of dried cherry and plum notes, while this feels fresh and snappy, with mild acidic burn. Briary plum and spicy berry flavors qualify as oaky, while this tastes of vanilla, mint and mixed spices on a lightweight finish.

title: Mocén 2016 Selección Especial Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Clean but standard citrus and apple aromas set up a mild, citrusy palate. This wine offers green banana, melon and citrus flavors in front of a similar-tasting finish.

title: Baron De Ley 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This is a fine gran reserva from a great vintage. Aromas of vanilla, cedar, earth and spiced black fruits lead to a fresh pure palate with tomato-like snap. Cherry, cassis, tobacco and chocolate flavors finish smooth and clean, with just enough tannic grip. Drink through 2022.

title: CVNE 2012 Imperial Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of baked blueberry and prune on the nose reflect the hot, dry vintage. The solid palate brings dense berry and plum flavors that show a touch of raisin prior to a fruit-laden finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Portal del Montsant 2015 Bruberry Carignan-Grenache (Montsant)
description: The modest cherry and raspberry aromas in this Carignan-Garnacha blend set up a buoyant palate with tight, rubbery tannins. It offers generic but sound berry fruit flavors and some oak. Chewy tannins mark the finish.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Selección  (Rioja)
description: Roasted berry, compost and earthy aromas are jumbled and not entirely fresh. This is narrow and resiny in feel, with oaky flavors of clove, milk chocolate and resiny berry fruits. Overall, there's not a lot to this other than oaky makeup.

title: Peñalba Herraiz 2015 Aptus 6 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cherry and dark plum aromas are solid on the nose. A raw, energetic palate is paced by bright acidity, while this tastes of blackened spice and blackberry. On a bold finish, peppery fruit flavors blend with lightly charred oak.

title: Pradorey 2011 Elite  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty, rubbery aromas seem underripe given how warm and generous 2011 was. In the mouth, this is gravelly and like sandpaper. Burnt gritty berry flavors are saucy, while this tastes of herbal berry fruits and oak on the finish.

title: Bodegas Aquitania 2016 Bernon Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Flowery white-fruit aromas are mellow. A round melony palate is a touch soft but holding on. Melon and peach flavors are basic but perfectly good, while this is just vital enough on the finish. Drink up!

title: Celler Piñol 2016 L'Avi Arrufi Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: A full, oily nose, with hints of melon and tropical fruit, is the greeting on this Garnacha Blanca from Terra Alta. There is pinch and tannic grip to the palate, while slightly bitter terpenes are notable on a flavor profile that includes melon and green banana. While you should drink this sooner than later, it's stout enough to last through 2022.

title: Brega 2015 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Ripe, syrupy plum and berry aromas are jammy and dense. This is a full-bodied Garnacha with 16% declared alcohol by volume. Candied black plum, cassis and brown sugar flavors are far from light and feminine, while this is chocolaty, calm and collected on a very ripe finish.

title: Lasalde Elkartea 2015 Txakoli Aitzalde Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Grassy aromas and a whiff of celery lead to a snappy palate with fresh but tart lemon, gooseberry and white-currant flavors. A juicy fresh finish with citrus flavors is typical of well-executed Txakoli.

title: Perelada 2012 Finca La Garriga Carignan (Empordà)
description: All of Perelada's wines are made in a flush bullish ripe style, and this varietal Samsó, which is the name for Carignan in Catalan, is particularly intense, smoky and earthy on the nose. On the palate, it's juicy and ripe, with plum, berry and overt oaky flavors. A chunky finish deals cassis and prune flavors. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2010 Monte Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Attractive aromas of mocha, vanilla, wood grain and healthy plum and red-berry fruits come in front of a creamy rich palate that some might say is a touch fat. Deep plum, cherry, cassis, vanilla and chocolate flavors are equally rich on a long finish with savory berry and vanilla-cream flavors. Drink through 2030.

title: Viña Pérez 2018 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Sweaty, gritty citrus aromas run heavy on pyrazines. A tight, crisp palate holds grassy flavors of green herbs and citrus fruits, while this Verdejo veers toward green vegetable flavors on the finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2012 Viña Alarde Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of raspberry, plum, tobacco and cedar are a touch reedy and raw. A somewhat dilute and lean palate deals tart cherry and red-plum flavors that hint at sourness. Tangy zesty acidity pumps up finishing salad-dressing-like flavors of vinegar, salt and herbs.

title: Scala Dei 2015 Prior Red (Priorat)
description: A saturated, grapy nose with jammy black-fruit aromas is massive but not exact. A blocky, clumsy palate is weighty and a touch stewed. Blackened berry flavors show every bit of this Garnacha-based wine's 15% abv. Notes of fig and chocolate are up front on a heavy finish.

title: Finca Antigua 2016 Crianza Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Aromas of raisin and dark plum are gritty and candied, while this Tempranillo feels fleshy but also highly acidic, sort of like aged vinegar. Short, basic plum and berry flavors finish lively and smacking.

title: Emina 2014 Prestigio Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Leathery blackberry, vanilla and tobacco aromas include a gritty burnt note that's not entirely welcome. This feels full and oaky, with good balance. Oak-based flavors of vanilla and mocha sit atop black-fruit notes, while this is balanced yet tannic on the finish, with a lingering flavor of vanilla. Drink from 2018–2023.

title: Cathar 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This is yet another very hard 2014 Ribera del Duero, devoid of elegance Its cherry, berry and herbal aromas lack focus, and its black fruit and toast flavors finish with scraping tannins.

title: José Pariente 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Sauvingon Blanc is the second grape in Rueda to Verdejo, but here's a good one for casual situations. A no-nonsense nose with white fruit scents and cactus notes leads to crispness on the tongue and flavors of stone fruits and passion fruit. A note of scallion spices up a citrusy finish.

title: Telmo Rodríguez 2015 Al-muvedre Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Leafy minty blueberry aromas announce this jammy Monastrell. There's no oak on this, nor much give to a linear flat palate. Blueberry flavors hold onto the nose's grassy herbal essence, while the finish tastes peppery and vaguely green.

title: Pazo de Barrantes 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Neutral white-fruit aromas lead the nose of this wine, while it's round on the palate, with just enough acidic cut to keep it from feeling oily. Briny peach and nectarine flavors finish with a mild salty note. Drink now.

title: Cellers Unió 2016 Roureda Llicorella Poboleda Vi de Vila Red (Priorat)
designation: Roureda Llicorella Poboleda Vi de Vila
description: Blackberry and raspberry aromas are both bright and jammy, while this is decidedly wiry, hard and acidic on the palate. Tart plum and currant flavors finish raw, with acidic burn. Freshness is fine but this is lacking in fruit, body and charm.

title: Bodegas Fuentespina 2012 First Label  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Creamy oak aromas shout “vanilla” and “wood resin” in full voice. This is a rough wine with stampeding tannins. Toasty boysenberry flavors are more pounding than elegant, while this tastes of bitter chocolate on an aggressive finish. Give this five years and it may show better but now it's massive and unsettled.

title: El Coto 2018 Rosado (Rioja)
description: A salmon color and dusty but nonspecific citrus and stone fruit aromas lead to a chunky palate that's low on pop and zest. Fleshy melon and stone fruit flavors are yeasty and finish with a skins-like essence and mild bitterness.

title: Cermeño 2017 Vendimia Seleccionada  (Toro)
description: Jumpy berry and black fruit aromas are clean but unsophisticated. A smacking palate with pounding acidity holds flavors of plum and berry fruits that don't deliver the ripeness and richness that Toro is known for. On the finish, this is grating and superficial.

title: Pittacum 2012 La Prohibición Garnacha Tintorera (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: An opaque black color and gritty aromas of toast and tar announce a dense, saturated, warm-vintage Garnacha Tintorera that's pumping with herbal blackberry notes. A pinching, tannic finish is a bit abrasive, while this tastes of peppery black fruits, while the savory, oaky finish with stewed, gamy notes is intense. Drink through 2020.

title: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2001 200 Monges Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Deep in color and floral aromas as well as still-ripe blackberry and plum scents, this Gran Reserva from one of the best vintages in modern Rioja history is chewy to its core, with a beam of bright acidity maintaining great shape. Bold berry and plum flavors are on display many years after harvest, while a ripe finish is spicy and confirms excellence; drink through 2028.

title: Columna 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Fresh peach in a bowl describes how this nicely made Albariño smells. Its round, full-bodied palate is balanced with acidity. And its fresh peach and apricot flavors lead to a chalky, minerally finish.

title: El Centimo 2010 Real Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Fresh plum, tomato and spice aromas are integrated. On the palate, this wine is ripe and saturated but not heavy. Generous flavors of caramel, vanilla, plum and berry fruits are smooth and chocolaty across the finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Peñalba Herraiz 2015 Carravid  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe modern aromas of black fruits and fine oak set up a flush palate with density and smooth tannins. Chocolaty oak flavors are wrapped around blackberry and plum notes, while this is savory tasting and doesn't hammer away on the finish. Drink this excellent Tempranillo through 2025.

title: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2013 Clave de Tábula  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas combined with oak, vanilla and coconut scents make for a full friendly nose. This feels choppy and abrasive. Woody flavors of coconut and black fruits finish full and tannic, which creates a raw blocky feel that time may tame. Drink through 2023.

title: Bodega Andrés Iniesta 2017 Corazón Loco White (Manchuela)
description: A mild nose marked by tropical and citrus aromas is a high point for this Sauvignon Blanc and Verdejo blend. The palate feels oily and pinched; its mix of tropical fruit and vegetal flavors leads to a briny finish with green notes.

title: Basagoiti 2014 Fuera del Rebaño  (Rioja)
description: Sweet oak, berry fruit and clove aromas lead to a palate centered on racy acidity. Salty plum and red berry flavors conclude with drying tannins, feeling bold and fresh. Drink through 2022.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2006 Federico Paternina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: First-take aromas of raisin and cotton candy are soft and sweet. Following that lead, this feels chunky but adequately acidic. Herbal, reedy raspberry and plum flavors finish with spice and chocolate notes. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2015 Óscar Tobía Blanco Reserva White (Rioja)
description: Overt oak and waxy apple aromas introduce this barrel-fermented Viura-led blend. A full-bodied palate is resiny due to this having spent 18 months in barrel. Creamy woody flavors of melon and banana finish with minimal kick and acidity, so drink through 2021.

title: Basagoiti 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Spicy reedy cherry and red-plum aromas open this high-acid sizzler from a cool vintage. Lean as a stick in terms of build, this tastes of raspberry, red plum and dry spices. A short but juicy and tight finish is ripping with acid. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2016 Viña Albina Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Traditional Rioja aromas of earthy berry, plum and wood spice set up a lively but jagged palate with drying tannins. Plum and cherry flavors are meaty and moderately spicy, while this boasts clarity and purpose on the finish.

title: Spyro 2014 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Bland, mature aromas of white fruits are on the weak side for Albariño. This feels round and oily, while briny leesy flavors lack pop and precision. A grabby aged finish is short on the free flow that this grape and region are known for. Drink immediately or wait for a newer vintage.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2013 Reserva Especial Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of prune, cassis and marzipan are surprisingly rich for this cold and difficult vintage in Rioja. It's full bodied and tannic, with plum, blackberry and prune flavors. Dark berry and meat notes mark the finish.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2016 Viña Temprana Old Vines Tempranillo (Campo de Borja)
description: This everyday Tempranillo offers chocolaty berry aromas. Tightly built, its dark, spicy raspberry and plum flavors finish bright and firm. A very good basic red.

title: Pago de la Jaraba 2014 Azagador Crianza Viñedos Propios Red (La Mancha)
description: Choppy berry aromas are earthy and contain notes of olive and dried leaves. This Tempranillo-led blend is free-flowing and solid on the palate. Cherry, plum and dry spice flavors are steady on a finish with some flesh to it.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2010 Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition  (Rioja)
designation: Finca Ygay Gran Reserva Limited Edition
description: Slightly overripe aromas of raisin and prune dominate the nose on this jammy, spongy-feeling gran reserva. Soft, ripe cassis and plum flavors come with spice and tobacco accents. On a savory finish, prune comes back into play, thus cementing a ripe, jammy essence. Drink through 2025.

title: Arrocal 2014 Passión  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Minty black fruit and grilled meat aromas lend this wine a green, herbaceous tone. Its tannic palate tastes of weedy berries and burnt wood. Herbal, green notes and raw tannins overpower the finish, feeling underripe at every point.

title: Coto de Hayas 2013 Fagus Selección Especial Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Right from the start, this is all about oak and not about quality fruit, balance or subtlety. Aromas of wood resin, milk chocolate and char lead to a rugged rough palate. Flavors of burnt wood and stewed fruit finish resiny. Year after year, Fagus smells and tastes like this: it's time for a reboot.

title: Viña Eguía 2015  Rioja
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas are slightly leafy and not without a touch of complexity. A full palate with ripe tannins registers as being right, while ripe plum and cassis flavors maintain brightness on a finish with sappy acidity.

title: Alta Alella 2012 Privat Opus Evolutium Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Privat Opus Evolutium Gran Reserva Brut Nature
description: Lime and mineral aromas drive the nose on this fairly full-bodied brut nature from a warm vintage. On the palate, this is balanced, with bubbles absorbed into the wine's fabric. Up-front salty notes are backed by briny apple, nectarine and yeasty flavors, while this is sophisticated and fairly complex on the finish.

title: Tres Buhis 2016 Tempranillo (Yecla)
description: Damp, rubbery berry aromas suggest compost. This basic Tempranillo feels grabby but also flabby. Jammy berry flavors are nondescript, while the finish on this standard wine is lazy, slightly tannic and stewy.

title: Finca Allende 2009 Calvario  (Rioja)
description: From a ripe year, this dark, single-vineyard Rioja is big and saturated. Aromas of earthy blackberry and tomato are not shy or subtle. Spiced black plum and salty black-fruit flavors land on a full finish that slowly ends with dark and spicy afternotes. Drink through 2025.

title: Camina 2017 Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Jumbled aromas of gummy red fruits and green herbs set up a chunky but flat palate. Soft, inexact red fruit flavors are wan, while this tastes herbal on a jammy finish.

title: Ochoa 2016 Calendas Tempranillo-Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Grassy berry aromas and oaky clove scents are unconvincing. This blend of Tempranillo and Garnacha feels wiry and a bit like vinegar. Blatant oak and tart plum flavors finish with a distinctly strong note of clove.

title: Paso a Paso 2016 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Prickly citrus aromas include notes of white flowers. Yeasty grapefruit and lime flavors are bland and short, while this ends flat, yeasty and lightly oxidized.

title: Rioja Vega 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry, raisin and oak aromas lead to an edgy palate with rubbery tannins. Plum and berry flavors are a touch raw and sappy, while this loses some steam on the finish, which tastes raisiny and mildly oxidized.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2014 Solo Selección Viñas Viejas Garnacha Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Mealy berry aromas are stewy and topped with a heavy load of oak-based carob and cocoa. In the mouth, this Garnacha feels sticky and dense. Dried dark-fruit flavors finish woody and medicinal, with heat and excess weight.

title: Emina 2015 Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Aromas of apple and hay are slightly oily but nice. Bright acidity renders this fresh and not too chunky, while flavors of dry oak, melon and salted apple finish steady, with a hint of lemon. If you are interested in barrel-fermented Verdejo, this is a good place to start.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Era Costana Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of cherry, vanilla, oak grain and spice are straight from the Rioja recipe book. A tight, pulling palate is healthy yet tannic, while this tastes of plum, cherry, vanilla and cocoa prior to finishing with red-plum, mocha and savory notes. Drink through 2026.

title: Pata Negra 2016 Roble  (Toro)
description: Furry, mossy plum and berry aromas are jumbled and suggest iodine. A thin, pinched palate shows vinegar-like acidity along with light, leafy flavors of currant and tomato.

title: Cellers Unió 2012 Roureda Llicorella Anyada Clássic Red (Priorat)
description: Schisty aromas of licorice and blackberry are touched up by a shot of cedary oak. This feels juicy and not that heavy or compact on the palate. Reedy, spicy plum and blackberry flavors come with lemony oak notes. This is toasty and spicy on the finish, with a spot of licorice. Drink through 2022.

title: Don Olegario 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple and vanilla-cookie aromas are mild. The slightly chunky mouthfeel suggests grape skins. Skins-driven flavors of lime and grapefruit finish with an oily texture and a taste of citrus peel.

title: Cepa 21 2014 Malabrigo  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cepa 21's top wine smells of savory oak, bacon fat, hickory wood and Bourbon barrel, meaning it's oaky. A fully packed palate is intense, with rough, drying tannins suggestive of sandpaper. Char and smoke flavors are at the top level, barely allowing for berry fruit to poke through. No surprise that coffee and toast flavors dominate the finish. Drink through 2030.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 Finca del Mar Monastrell-Petit Verdot (Valencia)
description: Plum and berry aromas are full but restrained. On the palate, this blend of Monastrell and Petit Verdot is fleshy and pulpy. Oaky plum and cassis flavors fade away slowly on the finish before getting replaced by more overt oak notes.

title: Protos 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This wine's citrus, cactus and dusty yeast aromas make for a solid entry. Its light, slightly dilute palate delivers lime, orange peel and green herb flavors into a steady, lasting finish.

title: Godelia 2013 Selección Godello (Bierzo)
description: To date, Godelia has done better with its Mencía than Godello. This wine smells like pine, wheat and match stick, all aromas related to underripe fruit. A stalky, corny flavor profile lacks ripeness, a theme that's replayed on the finish.

title: Evaia 2016 Rosé (Rioja)
description: Mild citrus, melon and peach aromas are clean. This wine feels solid and a touch plump, but with agility. Peach and melon flavors are simple, and it's fresh, tasty and fairly elegant on the finish.

title: Celler Pasanau 2012 Los Torrents Red (Priorat)
description: This ripe rich blend of 50% Garnacha and 50% Carignan (Mazuelo) smells schisty, woody and earthy, with ample berry fruit. While this is stacked on the palate, it's also well balanced. Ripe black-fruit flavors show notes of buttery oak and chocolate, while this finishes toasty, warm and full of lush black-fruit flavors. Drink through 2024.

title: Arráez 2017 Callabuig Tempranillo (Valencia)
description: Lean cherry and currant aromas are not all that ripe or convincing. A smacking palate holds flavors of candied red fruits, while a hot and fiery finish closes out this wine.

title: Vall Llach 2014 Embruix Red (Priorat)
description: Schist, cola, cassis, berry and tobacco aroma cover all the bases in this wine. It's grippy and chewy but complete. Dark, earthy mulled berry flavors precede a tannic, pulpy finish with lasting plum and cassis notes. Drink through 2021.

title: Montebuena 2015 Cuvée KPF  (Rioja)
description: Punchy cherry and berry aromas are wiry. This wine is acidic and raw in feel, with tart flavors of pie cherry and plum. An angular finish is driven mostly by sharp acidity.

title: Bodegas Ugalde 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Floral aromas of cherry and plum are on the light side, which is not a criticism. A snappy, pulpy palate is a bit rubbery and raw, while this Rioja Crianza tastes of raspberry and salty red plum. A mild finish is an apropos ending to this easy-drinking blend of Tempranillo, Garnacha and Mazuelo (Carignan).

title: Montecillo 2001 Gran Reserva Selección Especial  (Rioja)
description: The rusty color, the subtle scents of root beer, smoked meat and leafy berry fruits, and a general air of complexity all help this fine Gran Reserva make its mark early on. A cushioned palate is both light yet deep. Ripe berry, mulled plum, fig and prune flavors finish with chocolaty notes of raspberry and plum. This is a classic Gran Reserva in peak form—the best Montecillo wine in decades. Drink through 2024.

title: Evaia 2017 Rosé (Rioja)
description: A dull and oxidized nose smells like little more than chewing gum. And that's really about as good as this gets. The rest of the package is stale, oxidized and going nowhere.

title: Raimat 2015 Castell de Raimat Albariño (Costers del Segre)
description: A yellow color and yeasty aromas announce a mature wine that's still holding onto a flowery essence. A plump body is balanced by citric acidity, while this tastes of tangerine and sea brine. A citric finish is lively, but this wine needs to be drunk soon.

title: Bodegas Ondarre 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of cherry, berry, tomato sauce and vanilla are smoky and slightly tarry. A flush, full mouthfeel is lifted by core acidity, while flavors of blackened spice, tobacco, toast and cassis finish with classic Rioja notes of vanilla, mocha, toast and warmth. Drink this winner through 2024.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2016 Bellmunt Vi de Vila White (Priorat)
description: A light color and simple aromas of apple juice are less than serious. A minimal palate doesn't have much to say, while this tastes of apple and green pyrazines. As a whole, this blend of Garnacha Blanca and Viognier is reasonably good but bland.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2015 Garnacha Rosado (Navarra)
description: This everyday wine feels chunky due to low acidity. Its dusty aromas are generic and not very fruity or expressive, and its meandering cherry and plum flavors precede a simple finish.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Reciente Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry and cherry aromas are jumbled at first, but better with airing. On the palate, this is kicking with acidity and choppy tannins. Plum and cherry flavors are bold on a tannic finish with a touch of heat. While tasty and intense, this reserva is brusque.

title: Pagos de Valcerracin 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smoky blackberry aromas break down with airing and turn earthier and more gritty. A bullish palate with drawing, abrasive tannins sets up blackberry, cassis and olive flavors, then an unruly finish tastes of savory berry fruits and chocolate.

title: Terras Gauda 2016 O Rosal White (Rías Baixas)
description: Lightly briny citrus aromas are typical of this Albariño-led blend. The chunky palate is acidic and driven, tropical with flavors of passion fruit and kiwi. A plump finish is slightly oily in feel and briny in flavor.

title: Valdelacierva 2016 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Rooty berry aromas include notes of forest floor and dried leaves. A full yet tight palate displays youthful exuberance and balance, while this Crianza tastes of blackberry accented by savory oak. A full finish isn't too heavy but isn't shy. Drink through 2024.

title: Celler Piñol 2016 Portal White (Terra Alta)
description: Waxy aromas of honeyed apples, petrol and lanolin introduce this blend of Garnacha Blanca, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. Its fleshy palate is cut by acidity, recalling tart apple and pineapple.

title: Trencalòs 2017 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Candied red fruit aromas are youthful and punchy. A light-to-medium palate is basic in composition, while this Tempranillo tastes of plum, raspberry, tomato and peppery spice. A juicy but simple finish brings this to a close.

title: Vega Sicilia 2012 Valbuena 5  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Lightly charred, toasty berry aromas come with a full covering of clove and baking spice scents in this plush wine. The palate is edged with drying tannins, bolstering exotic berry, spice and herbal flavors. Its long, balanced finish features chocolate and unabsorbed oak. Drink through 2022.

title: Vallobera 2017 Famillia San Pedro White (Rioja)
description: This wine's generic melon and white fruit aromas are backed by a green note of pyrazine. It's equally basic on the palate, with stalky, oxidized white fruit flavors.

title: Godelia 2017 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Briny aromas of generic white fruits and haystacks are undistinguished. A fiery palate is grabby and citric, while this tastes melony but also stalky and slightly bitter on a modest finish. This is 80% Godello and 20% Doña Blanca.

title: García Figuero 2012 Tinus  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Extremely ripe aromas of prune, blackberry, cassis and cinnamon announce a jammy loaded palate that weighs nothing short of a ton. The flavor profile is a black-fruit bonanza accented by graphite and blackened toast. Drink this monster wine from a dry, hot vintage from 2019–2034.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 El Miracle 120 Aniversario Shiraz-Garnacha Rosé (Valencia)
description: This blend of Shiraz and Garnacha is simple on the palate, with modest acidity. Powdery berry and stone-fruit aromas are basic.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Cerro Añon Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Olarra turns out a lot of wines across many labels and at some point they become one in the same. For what it's worth, this reserva opens with smoky, oaky aromas and fruit notes that suggests hand lotion. A rubbery and full palate offers red fruit tannins backed by darker fruit flavors. This is tight and tannic on the finish.

title: Eguren Ugarte 2013 Cincuenta  (Rioja)
description: Raspberry, strawberry and oaky shoe polish aromas comprise the nose on this pinching rubbery Rioja from a cold vintage. Plum, cherry and raspberry flavors finish fresh and ripped, with tannins that won't quit. Drink through 2020.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2016 Laderas Del Norte Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Reduced berry and olive aromas require a lot of air, swirling and patience to unwind. An amorphous palate is grabby, fleshy and fat, while this tastes of jammy dark plum and various spices. A round, obtuse finish deals latent oak and coffee notes.

title: Cuatro Rayas 2016 Cuarenta Vendimias Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A nose with mild citrus and banana aromas is indicative of the fleshy but basic wine that follows. Dry flavors of peach pit are slightly bitter, and it's dull on the finish. This wine marks Cuatro Rayas's 40th year.

title: Torres 2012 Mas la Plana Cabernet Sauvignon (Penedès)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon from Penedès is on the money. A smooth, creamy nose of vanilla, oak and berry aromas leads to a ripe, saturated palate with a meaty texture. Flavors of black fruits, wild herbs, licorice and spice are long, savory and chocolaty on a finish that lasts three minutes. Drink from 2019–2030.

title: Otazu 2006 Altar Red (Navarra)
description: Cool rooty aromas of cola and tree bark grace the nose on this ripe but still not fully mature Cabernet Sauvignon (with 5% Merlot). In the mouth, this is choppy due to sandpaper tannins. Flavors of sarsaparilla, pepper, and blackberry are dense and chewy, while the finish is bumpy and scraping due to aforementioned hard tannins. Drink or hold through 2022.

title: Otazu 2010 Señorío de Otazu Cabernet Sauvignon (Pago de Otazu)
description: Berry and plum aromas are herbal and include cheesy oak notes. On the palate, this Cabernet Sauvignon from Navarra is high in acidity and choppy in feel. Modest flavors of berry fruits are lessened by dry tannins and fiery heat on the finish.

title: Besllum 2012 Red (Montsant)
description: Earthy red berry aromas include notes of coffee and fallen leaves. A medium-bodied palate is solid and focused. Dry raspberry, currant and plum flavors are reserved more than effusive, while this blend of Carignan, Garnacha and Syrah offers cocoa and mild red fruit notes on a finish with dry tannins.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2014 Cerro Añon Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This wine's ripe, raisiny aromas include vanilla and a hint of animal hide. Its dense, oaky palate is generally in balance, with plum, tomato, spice and vanilla flavors typical of Rioja. It flattens out on the finish, tasting slightly baked.

title: Vallobera 2014 Finca Vallobera  (Rioja)
description: Grassy scents accent this wine's prune and raisin aromas. It's chunky but also high in acid, so the mouthfeel has balance issues. Its raisiny berry flavors are slightly oxidized and spicy on the finish.

title: Crápula 2014 Basado En Hechos Reales Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Ripe, grapy, floral aromas introduce this plump, chunky Monastrell. Soft tannins make the palate amorphous. Its baked plum and berry flavors are a touch raisiny, and the finish is heavy.

title: Finca Allende 2016 Martires Single Vineyard Estate Bottled White (Rioja)
description: Lemony oak is the lead aroma on a round powerful nose with strong barrel influences. Substantive, round and deep, this barrel-fermented Viura is classic in style. Flavors of buttery oak, wood grain, spiced apple and nutmeg finish long, with the lasting impact of nine months spent in French oak. Drink through 2024.

title: Coto de Hayas 2016 Centenaria Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: This $15 Garnacha is heavily oaked and smells singularly of clove. The palate is sticky and cloying, with artificial clove and allspice flavors. Way too much oak has been thrown at totally average fruit here, and the result is forced and fake-tasting.

title: Casa La Rad 2015 White (Rioja)
description: From the start, this oak-aged white blend is smooth and nicely knitted together, with peach, vanilla and tropical fruit aromas sticking out. A full-bodied palate is balanced by citrusy acidity, while this tastes explicitly of green apple and oak, with buttery notes rising up on the finish. Drink this elevated acid-driven mix of Chardonnay, Malvasia and Viura through 2025.

title: As Laxas 2017 Vieira de Plata Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: With a tan color and apple juice aromas, this is not pinpoint sharp up front. A palate with adequate acidity and weight holds chunky flavors of nectarine and orange. Mild bitterness and briny notes rise up on the finish.

title: Parés Baltà 2010 Blanca Cusiné Sparkling (Cava)
description: There's hardly a top-shelf 2010 Spanish wine that didn't excel, and this blend of Xarello, Chardonnay and Pinot Noir is no exception. Aged, mature aromas of briny fruits and yeast are integrated and smooth. A citrusy palate is vibrant, while this tastes of grapefruit and tangerine. Lightly buttered toast and white pepper notes appear on a long-lasting finish.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2015 Organic Wine  (Rioja)
description: Funky horsey murky aromas suggest compost and sweaty animal. A blocky grabby palate and disjointed woody and weedy flavors finish with foxy notes. Nothing about this organic wine impresses.

title: Llopart 2016 Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty white-fruit aromas are clean and basic, while this brut feels a bit foamy but helped by firm acidity. Apple, green pear and yeasty vanilla flavors wrap up on a finish that holds form. While this vintage Cava isn't a thriller, it's more or less faultless.

title: Pagos del Moncayo 2016 Prados Colección Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of peanut butter, stale almonds, murky earth and burnt fruits amount to a messy whole. On the palate, this is chunky and short on balance. Flavors of burnt wood, barbecued pork and black fruits finish with clove and campfire notes.

title: Bodegas Ontañón 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Oaky notes of vanilla and tree bark lead a woody nose toward a punchy palate with sharp acidity. Lean cranberry and sour plum flavors are shearing, while this tastes both gamy and tart on a lean finish with low body weight.

title: Valserrano 2016  Rioja
description: Cherry and cassis aromas are closed down. This Mazuelo, globally known as Carignan, is full of power but also astringency. Unsurprising black-cherry and plum flavors darken up on a hard-pounding finish that doesn't overplay the oak. While not a cellar selection, this will last for decades due to its high acid-and-tannin level.

title: Naveran 2016 Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Right away this is funky on the nose, with briny aromas and a sense of resiny wood. A briny palate is texturally thick, while this tastes of brined citrus and savory notes.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2014 Don Ramón Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Off the bat, this smells a bit like fruit punch, although with time it stiffens. A chunky heavy somewhat flat palate tastes of clove, chocolate and berry and plum.

title: Dominio de Eguren 2018 Protocolo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Dusty orange-peel aromas lead to a palate that's mildly citric in feel but mostly just blunt. Citrus and dry melon flavors deliver the basics, making this right for easy quaffing.

title: Txomín Etxaníz 2017 Getaria Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)
description: A shiny pink tint and bright aromas of nectarine and citrus fruits announce a round yet citric palate with freshness. Pink grapefruit and mild red-fruit flavors mellow out on a finish that doesn't last long.

title: Pinuaga 2016 Nature Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: While this Tempranillo opens with mulchy, cheesy aromas that suggest less than ideal raw materials, flavors of tomato, creamy oak and herbal plum gain some momentum before finishing short and green. As for feel and structure, this is plump and grabby.

title: Bodegas Soledad 2017 Solmayor Tempranillo (Uclés)
description: Simple, spunky aromas of cherry and raspberry candy are not that serious. This Tempranillo feels full and jumpy, but with little focus. Like the nose, this tastes of cherry candy, while the finish disappears in no time.

title: Montecillo 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Modest but classy raspberry, plum and oak spice aromas get this gran reserva going in the right direction. A full-bodied palate reveals edgy tannins, while this tastes lightly toasted and blackened, with plum and berry fruit at the foundation of a long, steady finish. Drink now through 2022.

title: Losada 2015 Altos de Losada Viñedos Viejos Pequeñas Parcelas Mencía (Bierzo)
designation: Altos de Losada Viñedos Viejos Pequeñas Parcelas
description: Dark aromas of graham cracker, blueberry, prune and creamy oak push the ripeness meter to high. This Mencía feels tight and a bit tannic, but also lush and a mile deep. Woody, smoky blackberry flavors finish with firm acidity, balance, depth and residual oak flavors that still need to be resolved; drink through 2024.

title: Altos De Rioja 2016 Altos R Pigeage Blanco Viura (Rioja)
description: Oak is the sole standout aroma on this barrel-fermented Viura. A plump, resiny palate shows the weight of oak aging, while this tastes woody more than fruity. A healthy-feeling finish with mild acidic pop tastes mostly of oak.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Fábula de Paniza Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Red fruit aromas are simple like a piece of sucking candy, while a gummy palate is where this Garnacha starts its slide. Weedy, sugary red fruit flavors seem artificial and the finish is cloying.

title: Coto de Hayas 2017 Centenaria Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Strange aromas of clove and beach grass are abnormal. On the palate, this Garnacha is sticky but enlivened by wiry acidity. Heavy oak flavors result in nothing but clove and cream, while this is cloying on a resiny palate that tastes of forced oak and clove.

title: Balbas 2014 Ritus  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas come with a fitting helping of toasty oak. On the tongue, this is tannic and resiny but not overly so. Flavors of blackberry, raisin, oak grain and vanilla dry up on a desiccated finish with mild oxidized notes. Drink through 2022.

title: Quinta da Muradella 2012 Gorvia Doña Blanca (Monterrei)
description: This is a mature, oxidized style of wine made from the local Doña Blanca grape; look for a mix of Galician minerality, Jura-like flavors and Sherry complexity. Aromas of resiny oak, roast corn and hay are dry, leading to a grabby palate, with a grape-skin texture. Woody, buttery dried apple flavors finish full and long, with popcorn notes and the essence of controlled oxidation. By no means is this for everyone, but it's well made and has its virtues. Drink now through 2023.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2018 Garnacha Rosé (Cariñena)
description: Orange-peel and pink-grapefruit aromas are mild and yeasty in front of a pulpy palate with citric pop. Basic flavors of orange and tangerine linger on a clean, simple finish, with a hint of yeastiness. Drink now.

title: Parxet 2012 Titiana Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty bready aromas are more smooth and leesy than fruity. This has a round palate that's full but not creamy due to firm acidity. Melon, peach and vanilla flavors finish yeasty and dry, with moderate complexity. This is made entirely from Pinot Noir.

title: Cruz de Piedra 2017 Macabeo (Calatayud)
description: This wine's chunky apple aromas hold onto their freshness. Its plump palate shows citrusy acidity and briny white grapefruit flavors. A touch of green lettuce and scallion emerges on the finish.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2013 Edición Limitada Red (Navarra)
description: Aromas of cherry, plum, forest floor and tobacco feed into a clampy palate with fresh acidity. Lightly spiced currant and red-plum flavors are limited in scope but nice, while this tastes herbal and feels tight and racy on the finish.

title: Viñas del Cenit 2013 Via Cenit Tempranillo (Tierra del Viños de Zamora)
description: Heavy oak gives this Tempranillo from Zamora an inky, resiny, charred set of aromas. Its muscular palate is softened somewhat by creamy oak. Woody mocha, blackberry, vanilla and spice flavors linger into the finish, feeling rich but also punchy and tannic. Drink through 2024.

title: Pazo Pondal 2015 Lenda Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: A briny-smelling nose is lacking in ripe appealing fruit. This feels pithy and oily, while bitter briny flavors come up short on fruit and friendliness. Pyrazines and bitterness control the finish.

title: Lagar de Indra 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Light citrus, peach and buttercup aromas are appealing and easygoing. A plump palate with citric acidity is round and healthy, while this tastes of citrus and tropical fruit. This is steady on the finish; drink now.

title: Pazo de Barrantes 2013 La Comtesse Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of green melon and pear are calm like a lake with no breeze. This feels mildly creamy, while leesy briny melon and peach flavors turn somewhat bitter prior to a soft easy finish that doesn't sing but doesn't fall off.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2016 Monte Real de Familia Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of cherry and berry fruits show well on the nose. This crianza is medium in body and a touch wiry due to sappy acidity. Flavors of plum, berry and vanilla are straightforward, while this is juicy and easy on the finish.

title: Torres 2014 Salmos Red (Priorat)
description: Grapy, floral aromas are friendly on the nose. There's all the saturated weight and intensity required of an excellent Priorat, but still Salmos is not demanding or tough. Blackened, toasty berry flavors and a charming finish make this good to enjoy through 2024.

title: CVNE 2015 Real de Asúa  (Rioja)
description: This wine's black fruit aromas are smoky with chocolaty oak and animal notes. On the palate, severe, citrusy acidity narrows down its savory plum, wood and lemon flavors. With so much youthful oak and acidity, it's wiry and angular now. Drink from 2020.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2009 Faustino I Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Classic Rioja aromas of vanilla, spice, tobacco and dried berry fruits carry this wine. On the palate, this warm-vintage gran reserva has energy from well-stored acidity, while the flavors include cherry, plum, mocha and a plethora of spices. Chocolate and tobacco flavors along with general warmth crowd the finish. Drink through 2030.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2010 Clos Fontà Grenache-Carignan (Priorat)
description: Pure but restrained violet, plum and berry aromas are on the money. This feels racy but also saturated, with kick as well as commendable overall balance. Flavors of plum, ripe tomato, schist and spice finish smooth, peppery, herbal and slightly warm, with a note of coffee. Drink through 2022.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Xtrem Red (Alella)
description: A dark color and overtly ripe aromas of blackberry, raisin and lemony oak lead to a palate that's full and lusty but also scratchy due to hard tannins and loud tartaric acidity. Toast and lemony oak flavors are attached to core boysenberry fruit, while this Catalonian blend is fueled by acidity on a lightly smoky finish.

title: Alidis 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Raisiny aromas are earthy but lack freshness, clarity and purity. A gritty, grinding palate is tannic and rough, while this warm-vintage reserva tastes of mint, prune and gamy berry fruits. On the back end, a minty green flavor infiltrates a hard-pounding, severely tannic finish.

title: R. Lopez de Heredia 2004 Viña Tondonia Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Slightly damp, earthy and cool aromas introduce this traditional Rioja. In the mouth, pinchy tannins and tomatoey acidity pave the way for flavors of raisin, peppery spice and leafy herbs. A long steady finish is full of life. Drink now through 2030.

title: Borsao 2015 Tocado Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Horsey blackberry and cherry aromas come with a note of latex. In the mouth, this is choppy and abrupt. Raw berry flavors finish with a mild sensation of heat.

title: Ostras Pedrin 2016 Verdosilla (Valencia)
description: In this Verdosilla, an obscure white variety from the Valencia region, yeasty, bready aromas are mild and slightly floral. Its palate is watery and not very crisp, with dry apricot flavors that have no zing.

title: Senda Verde 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This juicy Albariño opens like a bowl of fresh fruit, with aromas of apple, pear, peach and melon. Stone-fruit and citrus flavors are slightly pithy and oily in character, while tangy orange and pineapple echo on a brief but clean finish.

title: Abadia Retuerta 2012 Estate Grown Selección Especial Red (Sardon de Duero)
description: Few wines offer as much as this for under $30, but this extracted, bullish Tempranillo blend is not for everyone. Blackberry, cola and savory herbal aromas are strong and pure. This feels wide and cushioned, yet is still a driller. Blackberry, cassis and chocolate flavors finish rich and ripe. Drink through 2024.

title: Ovidio García 2012 OG Esencia Crianza Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Grapy black-fruit aromas are adorned with more than enough oaky vanilla. This is grabby and acidic. Flavors of cherry, wild berry, tobacco and vanilla finish in similar fashion, with brightness fostered by ultra high acidity. This is good and rugged but short on ease and flow.

title: Emilio Moro 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Despite a hint of green to the nose, this comes around. Tight clampy tannins make for a tough, youthful mouthfeel, while this tastes woody, with black-fruit flavors in support. There's a lot of oak on the finish, but airing and/or time in the bottle will help that subside. Drink through 2023.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Blanc de Neu Organic White (Alella)
description: Aromas of grilled corn, haystack and dried apricot are far from fruity and peppy, and while this is a bit heavy on the palate, it finds its groove amid honeyed flavors of stone fruit and pineapple. By the time this finishes, mango and pineapple flavors are in full bloom. Drink now.

title: Gaintza 2017 White (Getariako Txakolina)
description: This wine's apple and citrus aromas are lean and dusty. Like most Txakoli wines, it's sharp and tangy on the palate, with spritz. Its briny gooseberry and lime flavors are salty, which again is typical for this style of Basque white wine.

title: Vicente Gandia 2017 Hoya de Cadenas Bobal Single Estate Rosé (Utiel-Requena)
designation: Hoya de Cadenas Bobal Single Estate
description: Powdery, slightly soapy aromas lack fruit and freshness. In the mouth, this rosé of Bobal is round and in decent shape, but with only mild acidity. Nonspecific orange and nectarine flavors finish short, without cleansing power.

title: Matarromera 2015 Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Mellow white-fruit aromas are nonspecific and oaky, but not overly so. This barrel-fermented Verdejo feels plump and chunky, with balancing acidity. Salty melon, apricot and apple flavors end steady and long. For barrel-fermented Verdejo, this is at the top of the pile.

title: Blanco Nieva 2016 Pie Franco Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This old-vines Rueda delivers green-leaning aromas of Granny Smith apple, lime and lettuce. A citric, stony palate is linear and direct, with fine-tuned acidity. Citrusy flavors of lime and green apple turn briny on the finish.

title: Raventós I Blanc 2014 De La Finca Conca del Riu Anoia Sparkling (Penedès)
designation: De La Finca Conca del Riu Anoia
description: Raventós I Blanc is one of Spain's best producers of sparkling wines, although theirs are no longer classified as Cava. This has aromas of briny apple and yeasty vanilla setting up a stony palate with narrowing acidity. Flavors of lemon and orange peel are from the brut nature school. It feels chalky and citrusy on a lean, long finish.

title: Xavier Flouret 2012 Pavo Real  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Earthy black-fruit aromas include notes of cigar box. This feels tight and acidic, but with plenty of oak. Flavors of woodspice and vanilla are more dominant than plum and berry notes, while this is thick but not entirely thorough on the finish.

title: Vizcarra 2015 Torralvo  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A hint of sweet maple on the nose gives way to blackberry, cassis and dark-plum aromas that are in great shape as they set up a lush and full palate. Ripe toasty blackberry and chocolate flavors remain fresh and fruity on a full finish that's not too tannic. For a ripe year, this Ribera del Duero is in superb form. Drink through 2030.

title: Belondrade 2016 Quinta Apolonia Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Briny, wayward aromas of grape skins and yeast are funky and unfocused. This Verdejo has a pulpy, soft mouthfeel and flat white-fruit flavors that turn bitter on the finish.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2011 Cerro Añon Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This is a fully oaked gran reserva with gritty aromas of lemony wood resin, milk chocolate and tarry grit. A wide palate is more big than precise, while this tastes of gamy berry, oak spice and cardamom. A minty but light oak character on the finish suggests tobacco and complexity. Best from 2022 on.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2015 Glorioso Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Smooth, spicy berry and black-cherry aromas are spread across a concentrated nose. A tight juicy palate is fresh, while this weighs in as medium-to-full. Lightly roasted berry and plum flavors include a spot of oaky vanilla, while this is mellow and emphasizes freshness and spice notes on the finish.

title: Regina Viarum 2014 Mencía (Ribeira Sacra)
description: Ripe raisin and black-fruit aromas come with a licorice sidenote. This feels tight and pure but not demanding, with proper balance. Plum, blackberry and chocolate flavors give way to a spongy fruit-driven finish.

title: Torre Castillo 2015 Alegre Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Jumpy aromas suggest wet animal, with milk chocolate in the background. This feels plump but also choppy, rough and grating. Green notes infiltrate jammy berry and milk chocolate flavors, while this is bitter, weedy tasting and disjointed on the finish.

title: Carlos Serres 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Rubbery berry aromas are earthy and on the lean side. In the mouth, this crianza is firm, with almost no give. Cherry flavors show a hint of raisiny overripeness, while this is solid on a basic finish.

title: Bodegas Roda 2016 Sela  (Rioja)
description: Full berry and plum aromas are ripe, lightly spiced and inviting. A fleshy, full-bodied palate features bold tannins, while this delivers sizable black-plum, blackberry and savory oak flavors. Rubbing tannins create texture on a deep finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Quirus 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Odd aromas of lemony oak and scented soap are dominant and block out this Crianza's fruit scents. A pinched high-acid palate holds soupy tomatoey flavors of savory red plum and currant. On the finish, this is tart, with rubbing tannins.

title: Pata Negra 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: An outright woody nose smells of sawdust and mint. On the palate, this young Tempranillo shows holes in the middle. Oak-heavy flavors of clove smother what fruit this has.

title: Viñedos de Paganos 2013 La Nieta  (Rioja)
description: Typically dark in color, with plum, blackberry and a touch of raisin on the nose, this feels a bit jammy, with a shock of acidity and hard tannins. Prune, baked plum and baking-spice flavors finish toasty and charred, with dry rough tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Maria Casanovas 2014 Brut Nature Gran Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty, bready aromas reflect time in the bottle, although for a gran reserva this is still young. Depth and cushion are present on a slightly foamy palate, while this wine is less about ripe fruit flavors and more about sourdough and fermented citrus notes prior to a lasting finish.

title: Avancia 2018 Cuvée de O Rosé (Spain)
description: Common rosé aromas of orange, nectarine and wet stones announce a plump but shallow palate. Based on the Mencía grape, this tastes of melon and apple juice in front of a medium-length finish, with average depth.

title: Sangenís I Vaqué 2004 Coranya Red (Priorat)
description: Earthy plum and berry aromas are lightly herbal, with a note of eucalyptus. In the mouth, this is gritty and grabby, which is surprising given that it's 12 years old. Gritty peppery berry flavors comfortably fade away on a spicy finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Abadia de Poblet 2016 White (Conca de Barberà)
description: Melony aromas are dulled by haystack and wheaty scents, while this Catalonian white feels full and generally well balanced. Lightly oxidized, leesy flavors of melon, white grapefruit and pineapple are not a common package, while this feels smooth, honeyed and creamy on the finish.

title: Lamin 2010 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Heavy oak is a front-row theme throughout this tannic, extracted, black-tinted Garnacha. Hot fudge sundae and sawmill aromas lead to a palate that's as tannic as sandpaper. Its charred, heavily oaked flavors finish chocolaty, with a lasting and overbearing taste of clove, lacking balance and clarity of fruit.

title: Marco Abella 2015 Òlbia White (Priorat)
description: Oxidized stone-fruit aromas blend with vanilla and rubbery notes on this blend of mostly Garnacha Blanca and Viognier. In the mouth, this feels resiny and creamy, and ultimately rather monotone. Vanilla and wood-resin flavors are prominent prior to an oaky finish that's low on fruit.

title: Carlos Serres 2017 Old Vines  (Rioja)
description: Uncomplicated cherry and raspberry aromas come with a latex note. A crisp, dry, tight palate doesn't have much weight or body behind it, while this tastes of spice, green tea, mild oak and simple red fruits.

title: De Bardos 2012 Suprema 30 Meses  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A smoky, heady nose is defined mostly by char, coffee and black-fruit aromas. In the mouth, this wine is solidly built but not too heavy. Toasty, chocolaty blackberry and cassis flavors don't change much on a bold, blocky finish that stays the course. Drink through 2027.

title: Contino 2015 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Malty berry aromas are supported by cocoa, mocha and berry-fruit scents. This has a jammy plum and berry palate, with a ripe, slightly desiccated red-fruit-flavor profile. Depth and balance drive the finish, which is usually a good indication that aging will only help. Drink through 2040.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2017 Viña Século Godello (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: This wine's stone fruit and green apple aromas are lightly briny and focused. It features a tight, centered palate with vivid orange, lime and green melon flavors. The finish is compact, minerally and driven by energy.

title: Valduero 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Mild cherry and berry aromas include a dash of baking spices. A crisp racy palate is based on fresh acidity and tight tannins. Earthy plum, cherry and currant flavors are the slightest bit oxidized, while this is steady and sturdy on the finish.

title: Arínzano 2016 Gran Vino Chardonnay (Pago de Arínzano)
description: A brownish-gold color and oxidized aromas suggest a wine that's both tired but also potentially complex and unusual. A plump palate is unfortunately mostly dull in feel, while this Chardonnay tastes of oak, dried white fruits and oxidation.

title: Contino 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
