description: Berry and oak aromas are not overly deep. On the palate, this is more defined, with lively acidity and popping fruit. Plum, spiced berry and currant flavors end with chocolaty oak, nutmeg and blueberry notes. Unlike most Contino wines, this one seems ready for near-term consumption; drink through 2024.

title: Embocadero 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Plum, black cherry and gritty notes of tar, asphalt and chalk dust control the nose on this wiry Tempranillo that's grabby, hard and tannic on the palate. Peppery berry-fruit flavors are steady across a bold finish. This still needs time to settle and soften; drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2010 Viña Albina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A ripe, earthy nose shows touches of raisin, peanut and dried cheese along with tobacco, all of which are textbook gran reserve traits. A deep, lush, integrated palate delivers chocolaty flavors of berry fruits, cassis and tobacco. On the finish, oaky notes of vanilla and chocolate blend seamlessly into berry and prune flavors. Drink through 2030.

title: Eguren 2015 Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Dry lime and citrus peel aromas are round and solid, nothing more. That more or less describes the palate, which tastes a little bit wheaty and dull, with a note of bitter melon on the finish. Drink now.

title: Artadi 2014 Garnacha Blanca (Navarra)
description: Aromas of gasoline and white grapefruit skins lead to tangy palate with good grip and weight. This tastes waxy, bitter and citrusy, with a hint of tropical fruit. Zesty acidity livens up the finish, which runs fairly long.

title: Gratavinum 2010 GV5 Red (Priorat)
description: Schisty berry aromas are very ripe and bit reduced, with a sense of cooked and raisiny fruit. A tannic palate is gritty and powerful. Warm, baked flavors of blackberry and cassis finish with hard tannins and oaky notes of coffee and toast along with Priorat's patented schist.

title: Beronia 2014 Tempranillo  (Rioja)
description: This wine's earthy plum and vanilla aromas are cheesy and rough. It's round on the palate, with spiced plum, herb and oak-based vanilla flavors that flatten out on the finish, showing mild oxidation.

title: Burgo Viejo 2018  Rioja
description: Reduced berry and black plum aromas include notes of rubber glove and latex. This everyday Rioja feels big and full, but also kind of clumsy. Slightly soupy flavors of plum and rubber remain on the finish.

title: Merum Priorati 2013 Inici Red (Priorat)
description: This Garnacha-led blend starts out fiery and pointy, while foresty berry and oak aromas turn more gritty as it breathes. A tannic palate is tight as nails, while plum, currant and herbal flavors finish a bit raspy and tannic. Reflective of a cool vintage, this is just ripe enough. Drink through 2022.

title: Sonsierra 2015 Barrel Fermented Viura (Rioja)
description: While this smells almost entirely like a barrel, the palate avoids being resiny and instead comes across as fresh and balanced. Oaky flavors are unavoidable, while melony fruit notes on the finish are dosed up with wood spice and a shot of freshening acidity.

title: Emilio Moro 2016 Malleolus  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Charred oak speaks loudest on a nose that fluctuates between clean and fruity and pointed and staunch. A choppy palate relaxes with airing, while this tastes of oaky berry fruits. On the finish, this reverts to woody, hard and tannic. Revisit this between 2022 and 2024 and it should be calmer and nicer to drink.

title: Val Sotillo 2013 Finca Buenavista  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Oak-based savory spicy aromas start out raw and rustic but find their way in front of a tight palate with hard tannins. Plum and currant flavors get a big boost from the barrel, while this tastes of tomato, plum and hickory on a tannic drying finish.

title: Don Olegario 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: White fruit aromas come across fine but basic and generic. A mouthfeel dictated by stone fruit and citric acid yields limited nectarine flavors. That same monotone nectarine flavor carries over to the finish.

title: Albet I Noya 2015 El Fanio Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: Neutral, slightly briny aromas are fresh but low on fruit. This has a slightly plump feel but not a lot of length or depth. Short basic white-fruit flavors match the nose, while this Xarello finishes dry in feel and mildly briny in flavor.

title: 12 Linajes 2011 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A welcoming opening consists of creamy oak, raspberry and exotic blueberry aromas. In the mouth, this is just right, with a seamless blend of acidity, rich oak, tannins and depth. The big three of Ribera flavors—intense berry fruit, chocolate and pepper—end with notes of toast and coffee along with length. Drink through 2024.

title: Juvé & Camps 2013 Gran Reserva Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Fresh minerally aromas of wet stone and nectarine feed into a mature palate that's not overly active or bubbly. Flavors of apple, celery, white pepper and green herb are classic for brut Cava, while this feels good on a mild finish. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2010 Añares Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Given how good 2010 was in Rioja, this Gran Reserva is disappointing and lacking but still reasonably decent. Stale, gritty aromas are burnt and foresty, while this feels sharp, lemony and tannic. Leafy flavors of tomato and plum suggest compost, while this is tough and gritty on the finish.

title: Bodegas Copaboca 2016 Finca Feroes Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Apple and apricot aromas lead to a simple but healthy palate. Stone fruit and citrus flavors are ample but flatten out on a low-acid finish.

title: Pago Casa Gran 2017 Falcata Casa Gran Crianza Red (Valencia)
description: Honest berry, plum and chocolate aromas come across as whole. On the palate, this blend of Garnacha Tintorera, Monastrell and Syrah is forward in a rugged way, with grinding tannins. Black-fruit and chocolate flavors are within the norms for the Valencia region, while this remains robust through the finish.

title: Rodrigo Méndez 2017 Cies Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This wine's nectarine and peach aromas are rather standard. Juicy, briny stone fruit flavors make for a bright palate that finishes well but without much complexity.

title: Volver 2015 Paso a Paso Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Medicinal berry and chocolaty oak flavors come in front of a high-acid, tartaric palate. This everyday Tempranillo tastes of oak, chocolate and slightly weedy plum. Overall, it's good enough to warrant a glass or two.

title: Pinord 2010 +7 Red (Priorat)
description: This ripe, healthy wine offers aromas of baked black fruits, licorice and raisin. In the mouth, it's more vital than on the nose; racy acidity and firm but pure tannins make sure of that. For flavors, look for savory tomato, plum, berry fruits, licorice and schisty minerality. Finishing notes of mocha, plum and coffee are braced by hard-driving tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Aljibes 2016 Viña Aljibes Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
description: Meaty blackberry aromas smell of soy sauce and game. A widespread palate comes with grabby tannins. Mint, oak and herbal berry fruit flavors are more sauvage than polished, while this blend of Tempranillo, Cabernet and Petit Verdot is tight on the finish, with rugged residual tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: As Laxas 2017 Laxas Sensum Albariño Sparkling (Rías Baixas)
description: Floral, dusty aromas are yeasty and green, and immediately this Albariño distinguishes itself as different from the sizable pack of Cavas and other Spanish sparkling wines. Oily, flowery flavors of clover and melon are distinct, while this shows notes of grass and scallion on the finish.

title: Agronavarra 2017 Ventana Garnacha (Navarra)
description: Rubbery berry and cranberry aromas come with grassy field notes. This Garnacha has a clampy, raw, tannic mouthfeel and pointy flavors of plum and berry fruits. A lean, grabby, rubbing finish gets the job done, but barely.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 1999 Excelso Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Light aromas of citrus and lemon peel suggest a lean aged wine. On the palate, this is linear, without a lot of body or layering. High-toned plum and citrus flavors are mostly monotone on the finish except for a light dusting of spice.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2015 Clásico Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, nutty berry aromas are leathery and struggle to suggest purity. A saucy palate shows firm tannins, while this tastes of tobacco, earthy plum and mixed spices. A long, savory finish with dried fruit flavors is classic for Rioja.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2013 Finca Ygay Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Baked plum and cherry aromas are spicy and classic for Rioja, while lively acidity lends spirit to the palate. Berry and currant flavors show a raisiny character on the back end and run steady through the finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Aragus 2016 Rosado Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Fleshy stone-fruit aromas announce a fuller-bodied wine made from Garnacha. Straightforward citrus and nectarine flavors are fresh and clean, continuing to a pithy, slightly briny-tasting finish.

title: Celler Bartolomé 2015 Clos Bartolomé Red (Priorat)
description: Earthy berry, licorice root, chocolate and vanilla aromas set up a full palate with chewy tannins. Baked, fully ripe berry flavors are chocolaty and fairly rich, while this holds on to its chocolaty oak character on a finish that's easygoing and more simple than complex. Drink through 2021.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Viña Tobía Viura (Rioja)
description: Floral and tropical aromas include a note of lemon blossom. This wine feels friendly, with enough acidity to create raciness. Slightly oily tropical fruit flavors hold steady on the finish. Drink now.

title: Clos de Nit 2015 Red (Montsant)
description: The tomato and plum aromas in this Garnacha blend are a bit soupy. Its chunky palate is heavy with generic berry fruit and a touch of oxidation. A solid, middle-of-the-road pour.

title: Bodegas Grupo Yllera 2014 Boada Campo de Bueyes Crainza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of game and sauced berries starts off this high-toned wine. The tannic palate offers flavors of medicinal plum and wood.

title: Albet I Noya 2016 Efecte Reserva Brut Rosé Sparkling (Penedès)
description: Stone fruit and red apple aromas set up a punchy, fresh and citric palate. This bright Penedès sparkler (don't call it Cava) tastes of pink grapefruit and peach, while the finish is fresh and forward.

title: Roger Goulart 2014 Gran Reserva Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: A reddish color and clean aromas of raspberry and red plum lead to a fresh and alert palate that shows good balance. Red apple, citrus and red berry flavors are direct and firm on a relatively short finish.

title: Carlos Serres 2018 White (Rioja)
description: Generic white-fruit aromas are clean in front of a citrusy palate, with some body to it. Briny citrus and stone-fruit flavors are, as you might expect, mild, short and fresh on the finish. This is 85% Viura and 15% Tempranillo Blanco.

title: Viña Olabarri 2011 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A full, ripe nose include aromas of vanilla, spiced plum and raisin, while this gran reserva from a hot year feels tight as nails on the palate. Spicy plum, currant, leather and earth notes capture the essence of a warm vintage, while this exerts a firm tannic grip on the finish. Drink through 2032.

title: La Gitana 2012 Viñas Viejas  (Ribera del Duero)
description: The nose of this wine is loaded with mocha, coffee and raisinated fruit notes. The palate offers dark, chocolaty flavors of toasted blackberry and oak, framed by ripe tannins. That oaky chocolate flavor carries over to the ripe, slightly hot finish. Drink through 2028.

title: Livius 2008 Garnacha  (Rioja)
description: A nose with oxidized baked-fruit aromas confirms that this 2008 is on the back side of its run. A jammy, reduced palate houses squeaky tannins and leads to a flavor profile ruled by raisiny, stewed berry fruits. Prune and baking-spice flavors control a soft, mature finish.

title: Nubori 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of spice and cinnamon accent gummy berry and plum scents. On the palate, this Reserva is smacking at first, then more pulpy. Grapy berry flavors show some oak, while this hollows out on a racy, snappy finish.

title: Navardia 2016 Made With Organic Grapes  (Rioja)
description: Raspberry and red-berry aromas are clean and fresh, but nothing more. A rubbing tannic palate is scratchy, while this organic-grape Rioja provides generic berry flavors that finish with astringency.

title: Rioja Vega 2018  Rioja
description: Aromas of Band-Aid and foresty berry fruits come with a hint of herbal green. A tangy, zesty palate leans toward angular, while flavors of plum and pie cherry finish crisp, zesty and clean. If ever there was a blueprint middle-of-the-road Tempranillo, this would be it.

title: Bodegas Ondarre 2016 Valdebarón  (Rioja)
description: Mild berry aromas are welcoming and not pushy. On the palate, however, this is more fierce, with raw tannins. Lightly herbal plum and berry flavors offer tasty subtleties on a tough-textured finish.

title: Hiruzta 2016 Berezia Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Sea brine, citrus and cider are the main aromas on this still Txakoli that's both round and smooth on the palate. Grapefruit and apple flavors are propelled by modest malic acidity on this fast-maturing Basque white. Drink now.

title: Chopo 2016 Red (Jumilla)
description: Heavy berry aromas give way to scented soap and cola notes. This blend of 80% Monastrell and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon is quite heavy, with a syrupy mouthfeel cut by rough acidity. Black-fruit flavors lack flow on a flush but stunted finish.

title: Atalayas de Golbán 2015 Torre de Golbán Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Bold berry fruit and spun-sugar aromas scream ripeness and oak. On the palate, this strikes as being tough, aggressive and forward in nature; nothing is reserved or subtle. Crackling plum and cherry flavors wrap up on a rough finish. More time in bottle could help this, but Crianzas shouldn't require a lot of patience. Drink through 2030.

title: Sonsierra 2013 Perfume de Sonsierra  (Rioja)
description: Heady aromas of cola, blackberry and licorice set up a youthful choppy palate with hard tannins and a sense of skins. Blackberry, licorice and charred toasty oak flavors finish dry, spicy and with a strong note of dark chocolate. Drink through 2028.

title: Ossian 2015 Viticultura Ecológica Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
description: Briny citrus aromas are a bit stale and vie with oak scents. This barrel-aided Verdejo is oily and resiny in feel. Salty apple and corn flavors are a touch oxidized, and on the finish that oxidized character is more amplified, with hints of popcorn and butter.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 Federico Paternina Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Tropical-fruit aromas are slightly oily but on target for Verdejo. This wine displays a full, round palate held together by acidity and white-fruit tannins. Lightly salty grapefruit flavors finish moderately long, with citrus overtones. Drink as soon as possible.

title: Legado de Orniz 2017 Cindus  (Toro)
description: An opaque purple color is ominous and backed by a raisiny nose that's sun-baked and sleepy. An oversize palate is tannic, while flavors of milk chocolate and bourbon barrel give this an oaky, forced character. A shallow finish confirms that this is a size-over-substance RDD.

title: Dios Ares 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Berry aromas are fiery and scratchy at first, then break down and become suggestive of olive. High acidity and not much body create crispness but also tart plum and cranberry flavors. Loud acidity is maintained on a raw finish.

title: Suertes del Marqués 2014 La Solana Listán Negro Cordón Trenzado Red (Valle de la Orotava)
designation: La Solana Listán Negro Cordón Trenzado
description: This Tenerife blend holds Listán Negro and Cordón Trenzado. The nose is a bit green and grassy, like cool-climate Cabernet. In the mouth, the wine is pulling and rugged, with rawness. Herbal, peppery red-fruit flavors feature a pyranzine-based taste of red chili, while the finish shows hard tannins and simmering heat. Drink through 2021.

title: Alta Alella 2015 Blanc de Neu Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: This gold-colored sweet Xarello is lightly oxidized, with aromas of butterscotch, baked squash and honey. The longer it sits, the better it gets, and that's despite blazing acidity. Flavors of pears in syrup, melon and honey finish long due to intense acidity.

title: Burgo Viejo 2009 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Soupy raisin and prune aromas are earthy and sleepy. This feels a lot like prune juice, but with tannins. Prune is also the sole flavor on this overripe but still decent gran reserva from a hot vintage.

title: Matsu 2015 El Viejo  (Toro)
description: Blackberry and cola aromas are infused with game and a touch of oak-based vanilla. A flush palate is packed to the brim, while this tastes of ripe black fruit and chocolate. The warm finish is loaded with fudge and cassis flavors, and overall this checks all the boxes for an excellent, modern red wine. Drink through 2025.

title: Baica 2015 Barricado Organic Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Intense aromas of inky, leathery black fruits announce a full, saturated palate that's bolstered by tartaric acidity. Plum, blackberry, raw oak and salty flavors are chocolaty on a finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Emina 2016 Tinto Fino Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Wild berry aromas are foxy and smell a bit like vinegar. This dark young Tempranillo is severely tannic and hard as rocks. Blackberry and boysenberry flavors finish salty and with rugged leftover tannins.

title: Godelia 2012 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Potent earthy cherry and animal aromas are neither too pushy nor overbearing. This is quite full and concentrated, with a ripe-fruit mix of black plum, blackberry and chocolate flavors. Chocolaty oak is even more out front on a deep finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Yemanueva 2014 La Tercia Bodega Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: This blocky Tempranillo smells dense and damp, with curry and earthy berry notes. Its chunky palate deals in heavy berry flavors that are low on elegance and high on tannin, and its finish is earthy and flat.

title: Monterebro 2016 Blanco Sauvignon Blanc (Jumilla)
description: A nose driven by punchy pyrazine-based aromas is sweaty and not encouraging. Other than spunky acidity, the palate on this Sauvignon Blanc is dilute. Briny flavors are raw and green, while the finish is hollow and tangy.

title: Artadi 2013 El Sequé Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Baked plum and blackberry aromas are accented by notes of dry herbs and desert rocks. Typically lush and plush, this Monastrell is also a bit soft. Flavors of blackberry, mixed spices, herbs and chocolate are savory and leathery on the finish, where a spot of mint leaf comes into play. Drink through 2022.

title: De Moya 2015 Maria Bobal (Valencia)
description: Floral and dusty berry aromas lead the nose of this Bobal, which was aged 12 months in oak and includes trace amounts of Merlot. It's tight and racy on the palate, with forward plum and cherry flavors. The finish is fresh but breaks up quickly.

title: Casal Novo 2016 Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: This bottling helps explain why Casal Novo isn't known for Mencía and instead emphasizes Godello. This smells earthy and damp. A shearing, highly tannic palate deals narrow gamy flavors of grape skins and plum skins. A raw fiery finish with underripe flavors is another negative.

title: Herència Altés 2017 Garnatxa Negra Rosé (Terra Alta)
description: This opens with stale, charmless aromas and a rough, raw texture. Its flavors are bland and disjointed, marked by lasting bitterness.

title: Urbina 2017 Viura (Rioja)
description: Waxy yellow apple aromas are less than vital, while this basic Viura feels round and a touch citrusy. Generic citrus flavors get the job done, but that's about it. A finish with a citrus-skins feel and mild oxidized notes says drink this now.

title: Emilio Moro 2015  Ribera del Duero
description: Forced oak aromas of milk chocolate and vanilla blend with blackberry and dark plum scents in this wine. It's abrasively tannic and rubbery on the palate, with stewed berry flavors and more oak notes. The finish is scratchy.

title: Viñedos de Alfaro 2018 Real Agrado Viura (Rioja)
description: A light color and stony aromas of minerals and green citrus foretell a light, fresh and balanced palate. Briny green melon and underripe peach flavors finish clean and minerally, but that's as far as this standard Viura goes.

title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2016 Menguante Selección Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Stewy aromas of raisin and prune include a warm note of leather. This Garnacha feels tannic and jammy. Flavors of raisin, blackberry and loud oak finish soft and jammy, with little to no structure.

title: Volver 2015 Single Vineyard Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: This wine's floral, grapy aromas are woody and a touch volatile. It's jammy and mouthfilling, with wiry acidity and soft tannins. Its jammy berry and black plum flavors finish flush, without much structure.

title: Lasalde Elkartea 2016 Aitzalde White (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Punchy aromas of citrus and cactus are not outright green but do show pyranize scents. A palate with honest body, grip and lemony acidity tastes of tangy lemon-lime and tangerine, while this is angular but not scouring on the finish.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2018 VII Viura (Rioja)
description: Generic white fruit aromas suggest green melon and apple, while this feels fresh and citrusy. Simple white fruit flavors finish short, with a lingering note of citrus. Consistent with prior years, this varietal Viura is par for the course.

title: Valdelana 2016 Agnus  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry fruits come with a slathering of oak-based milk chocolate. This wine feels chunky and heavy, while a mix of leafy berry flavors with oxidized raisin notes finishes jammy.

title: Marqués de Gelida 2014 Marques de Gelida MIM Natura Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Marques de Gelida MIM Natura Brut Reserva
description: A blend of bready aromas along with crisp apple and pear scents leads to a citrusy palate of lime and green melon. The lasting finish is a good way for things to conclude.

title: Marques de Tomares 2010 Monteleiva Gran Reserva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia  (Rioja)
designation: Monteleiva Gran Reserva Colección de Bodega Tradición de Familia
description: Smoky, toasty oak sits atop hard spice, earth, floral berry and vanilla aromas on a nose that's complex and true to Rioja gran reserva. A tight-wire palate is firm and braced by racy acidity combined with ripe, hefty fruit. Cherry, plum and currant flavors are savory and saucy, while this closes with power and tension, indicating that it will be good to drink for at least another 15 years.

title: Camino de Cabras 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple and peach aromas along with stony minerality render the nose legitimate. This feels lemony and correct. Green apple, stone fruit and a dash of salt are the flavors, while this shows mild to medium acidity throughout.

title: Valserrano 2016 Blanco White (Rioja)
description: A nicely oaked bouquet includes aromas of tropical fruits, melon and green banana. This has a full, creamy palate, with oak resin and acidity balancing each other out. Salty melon and banana flavors are oaky, while this is texturally pleasing on the finish.

title: Juvé & Camps 2017 Gregal D'Espiells White (Penedès)
description: This blend of Gewürztraminer, Malvasia and Muscat is highly aromatic but not at ease, meaning the nose is soapy and smells unnatural. A flat palate with no edge holds dull flavors of lychee and little else. On the finish, this turns bitter and oily.

title: Pagos del Rey 2016 Sentero  (Toro)
description: After cheesy barnyard aromas blow off, this simple Toro offers up baked, lightly medicinal flavors of berry fruits and raspberry. A short, lightly herbal finish tastes minty and shows gummy tannins.

title: Pinea 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Rubbery pencil eraser scents accent this wine's blackberry and menthol aromas. It's a heavyweight, with chunky blackberry and fig flavors swathed in chocolate notes from aging 30 months in French oak. It remains oaky and thick into the finish. Drink through 2032.

title: Aspaldi 2010 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Briary plum and leather aromas are slightly toasty. This feels just chewy and dense enough to rise above lean and dainty. Spicy peppery berry flavors come with a dusting of chocolaty oak, while the finish hums along with a firm but manageable tannic grip. Drink through 2021.

title: Rejadorada 2016 Roble  (Toro)
description: Dark berry aromas are slightly complex and minerally, with a hint of hot stones. This Toro feels big and fleshy, but also slightly choppy. Blackberry, plum and chocolate flavors slowly drift away on a steady, direct finish.

title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2008 Kripta Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: A bready, yeasty nose announces that this brut nature is more than ready to drink. In the mouth, it's smooth, but light on verve and bubbles. Oxidized flavors of spent yeast, bread dough and sautéed mushroom finish dry and reserved, but somewhat flat. Drink now.

title: Marco Abella 2016 Loidana Red (Priorat)
description: Gamy, rubbery berry aromas are short on purity and fruit. An obtuse, chunky palate includes hard grabby tannins, while this tastes of soupy plum, tomato sauce and vanilla. Scraping tannins and chunky weight block this from ending with any elegance.

title: Con un Par 2017 Monastrell-Petit Verdot (Valencia)
description: This smells stalky and underripe, with hardly anything fruity or appealing about the nose. A hard-as-rocks palate delivers drilling tannins and roasted plum flavors that barely make it to a scraping finish.

title: Bodegas Aquitania 2017 Bernon Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Entirely fresh aromas of apple and honeydew rank as pure and inviting. On the palate, this is buffed and stony, like a good Rías Baixas Albariño should be. Nectarine and citrus flavors finish well on a long, effortless finish.

title: Martín Berdugo 2016 Rosado (Ribera del Duero)
description: This wine's basic red fruit aromas are clean but flat. That flatness carries over to the palate, which feels rubbery and lacks acidity. Its bland plum and cherry flavors are slightly bitter, concluding with a low-energy finish.

title: Otazu 2013 Premium Cuvée Red (Navarra)
description: A charred, fiery nose holds aromas of burnt wood and roasted blackberry and plum. A dense, compact palate is piercing and heavy, tasting of roasted black fruits and black olive. A smoked, resiny palate smolders with residual oak.

title: Juvé & Camps 2015 Gran Reserva Reserva de la Familia Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
designation: Gran Reserva Reserva de la Familia Brut Nature
description: Wayward aromas of white fruits and wildflowers are suggestive of apple juice. A foamy but thin palate deals lean flavors of celery, lettuce and green apple. On the finish, this is light and mild, nothing more.

title: Bodegas Olarra 2011 Summa Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Baked slightly raisiny black-fruit aromas tell you that 2011 was a ripe vintage. In the mouth, this is pushed by fresh acidity and weighty berry fruit. Peppery flavors of black plum, blackberry and spice show outsize oak on the finish. Drink through 2024 with the understanding that as each year passes this will taste less oaky and more integrated.

title: Ferrer Bobet 2011 Selecció Especial Vinyes Velles Carignan (Priorat)
description: An opaque color is a fair warning of what's to come: namely rubbery minerally black-fruit aromas that scream old vines. In the mouth, this blocky Carignan is flush and shows wall-to-wall saturation. Wild aromas of mountain herbs, blueberry and boysenberry finish sinewy and with spicy minerally black-fruit leftovers. Drink through 2023.

title: Izadi 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A ripe, fully oaked nose includes charred aromas along with herbal plum and currant scents. This wine has so much pep on the palate that it feels a touch raw, with a resiny oak offset. Woody plum and raspberry flavors finish with a final blast of oak.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2018 Edición Rosa Rosé (Navarra)
description: Clean, mild and welcoming aromas of cantaloupe open this pale-colored rosé. There's texture and fullness to the palate, along with dry melon flavors that rank as fresh. A steady finish takes a while to quit.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2013 Finca El Bosque  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of cola nut, bacon, blackberry, licorice and wood smoke announce a raw rugged palate that's not nearly as plump and lush as it normally is: a clear reflection of the cool 2013 vintage in Rioja. Dry peppery black-fruit flavors finish with toasty oak and licorice notes. Although rough and rugged now, this should improve little by little through about 2030.

title: Scala Dei 2016 Garnatxa (Priorat)
description: Rubbery aromas of latex and sulfur give way to jumpy red-berry and animal notes. A jammy sappy palate requires airing to show its best, while this varietal Garnatxa tastes of herbal raspberry and red plum. A rubbery grating finish fits the overall package.

title: Josep Grau Viticultor 2014 Vespres Red (Montsant)
description: Cherry cough drop and cassis aromas are red in nature. Dense and compact on the palate, with plum and currant flavors, this finishes with residual tannic rub and increasingly intense berry fruit. Elegance and charm are fleeting.

title: San Antonio Abad 2017 Delicioso Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Scalped raspberry and plum aromas are limited. This feels round but awkward, while candied plum flavors lead to a rubbery-feeling finish with the same flavors that came before.

title: Esperanza 2016 Estate Grown and Bottled White (Rueda)
description: Lemon and tangerine aromas are slightly dusty. In the mouth, this Viura-Verdejo combo is lively and bouncy. Pithy citrus, almond-skin and apple flavors finish juicy.

title: Edetària 2015 Selecció Old Vines Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: A heavy coating of oak dominates over mild fruit tones on the nose. This old-vine Garnacha Blanca is textured, with briny white-fruit and resiny oak flavors.

title: Palacio De Canedo 2017 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Pear and apple aromas lead to a medium-bodied palate with healthy acidity and mineral notes. Stone fruit flavors control the flavor profile, while this is braced by bold acidity and stoniness on the finish.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2014 Cosme Palacio 1894  (Rioja)
description: Cheesy oak and raw cherry and plum aromas create a nose that needs time in the glass to show its best. This Rioja feels fresh and tight, with pulling tannins. Zesty plum and cherry flavors carry a peppery side note prior to a snappy finish with similar flavors.

title: Marques de Griñon 2012 AAA Red (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: Ripe years like 2012 can produce mammoth wines in places like Dominio de Valdepusa in Central Spain, and this is indeed a huge black seriously ripe blend of Graciano, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Raisin and prune aromas are in the lead, and there's fiery oak to go with that. Flavors of prune, chocolate and blazing oak match the nose, while this ends with the thud of extremely ripe fruit, tons of oak and soft tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Suertes del Marqués 2015 Trenzado White (Valle de la Orotava)
description: Hailing from the volcanic soils of Tenerife in the Canary Islands, this blend of Pedro Ximénez and Listán Blanco opens with aromas of citrus peel and honey. A powerful palate is angular and smacking. Salty citrus flavors reflect an ocean influence, while the wine is strong on the finish.

title: Príncipe de Viana 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosado (Navarra)
description: This is almost red in color, with spicy bell pepper aromas resulting from early harvested Cabernet Sauvignon. Its full, chunky palate shows yeasty, lightly green and peppery flavors that linger on the finish.

title: Aspaldi 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum, cherry, spice and tobacco aromas are familiar to Rioja. A high-acid medium-bodied palate is austere and hard as nails. Tart red-fruit flavors finish racy and fiery, with excess gas in the tank.

title: Antaño 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Stemmy, musky aromas of clove and men's cologne announce a big and overwrought palate that could use more lift and elegance. Toasty, peppery berry flavors transition to tomatoey and herbal prior to a finish that simmers with toasty oak but not much fruit.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Viña Albina Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Heavy aromas of raisin, oak and chocolate are copied on the palate that tastes of oak, vanilla and raisiny fruit. It has a woody finish.

title: Finca Sobreño 2013 Crianza  (Toro)
description: This wine's fiery nose holds oak spice, red fruit, tobacco and chocolate aromas. It's full and grippy on the palate, with hard tannins. Oaky flavors of vanilla and cocoa bolster moderately ripe cassis and plum fruit. A creamy quality persistents on the finish.

title: Raventós I Blanc 2015 De La Finca Conca del Riu Anoia Sparkling (Penedès)
designation: De La Finca Conca del Riu Anoia
description: Yeasty aromas include fruit-based scents of peach and melon. This has a full and plump mouthfeel with some citrusy acidity to keep things fresh. Mild citrus and papaya flavors are mellow and don't overpower, while this is steady on a dry finish without any additional flavor notes.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2014 Clos Fontà Vinyes Velles Bellmunt Red (Priorat)
description: Berry, cherry and cola aromas exhibit an iron component on what amounts to a fresh minerally nose. Iron also describes the grip on this Garnacha-led wine from the village of Bellmunt. Dark-berry, black-currant and raisin flavors finish with dry rough tannins. Drink through 2034.

title: Obalo 2015 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Aromas of peach pit and dry melon are firm and clean but nothing special. This feels fresh and correct, nothing more. Pithy briny stone-fruit flavors are steady on the finish, which shows good weight and balance. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Corellanas 2013 Viña Rubican Crianza Red (Navarra)
description: Earthy plum and prune aromas straddle the line between ripe and baked. This wine is tight and firm on the palate, with good flow. Dark, toasty oak is matched to berry and black-plum flavors. It's long on the finish due to ripping acidity.

title: Altavins 2011 Almodí Petit Red (Terra Alta)
description: This blend of Garnacha, Syrah, Merlot and Samsó (Carignan) smells like a burning field. A tight, pulling palate holds underripe, herbal red fruit and turnip flavors. It's both hot and herbal-tasting on the finish.

title: Bodegas Cristo de la Vega 2016 Camina Rosé Tempranillo (La Mancha)
description: Light red-fruit aromas include a note of chewing gum. This wine is medium in body and solid in feel. Currant and nectarine flavors are basic and snappy, persisting on the finish.

title: Coto de Hayas 2017 Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)
description: A light color and equally light aromas of lime and little more introduce a linear palate that's oily feeling and acidic and pulls inward. Briny, tart nectarine flavors do a quick fade on a finish that rings with acidity.

title: Paixar 2015 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Grapy aromas of cassis and blackberry are fairly foxy, with a whiff of wet animal fur. An intense palate is held together by firm, rubbery tannins. Black cherry and dark-plum flavors are lasting on a finish that's ripped with intensity. Best from 2019–2024.

title: Marqués de Murrieta 2014 Finca Ygay Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This reserva from a not-so-good vintage smells floral, much like red roses. A pulpy palate is fleshy and short on focus, while this tastes of candied plum, raisin and cherry tomato. A slightly metallic flavor is up front on the finish.
